0.title: Russia halts peace treaty talks with Japan over sanctions
0.article_body: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Monday said that Russia has decided to withdraw from peace treaty talks with Japan in response to sanctions imposed by the Japanese government over the conflict in Ukraine. It also accused Japan of "consciously choosing an anti-Russian course". Japan claims four Russian-controlled islands as its own in a dispute dating back to World War II.

1.title: Akhilesh alleges irregularities in vote counting during UP polls
1.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged that there were irregularities in counting of votes during the Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls. He said that the SP candidate from Varanasi South was leading till 20 rounds of counting. However, counting of votes was suddenly stopped and some time later, BJP's Neelkanth Tiwari, a minister, was declared the winner, he added.

2.title: 3 workers missing after blast at dynamite factory in Greece
2.article_body: Three workers were reported missing following an explosion at a dynamite factory in northern Greece, authorities said on Monday. "This...explosion...was detected dozens of kilometres away," the regional governor, Giorgos Kasapidis, said. "Explosives experts and rescue specialists are on the way to secure the site and make sure there are no secondary consequences from the...explosion," he added.

3.title: 10-minute gamble with worker's life: Karti on Zomato's 10-minute delivery service
3.article_body: Congress MP Karti P Chidambaram on Monday criticised Zomato's upcoming 10-minute food delivery service 'Zomato Instant' and tweeted, "This is a ten-minute-long gamble with a gig worker's life." He also tweeted, "This is absurd! It's going to put undue pressure on the delivery personnel, who are not employees & who have no benefits or security or bargaining power with Zomato."

4.title: More than 25% crowd likely to be allowed in stadiums for IPL 2022: Reports
4.article_body: IPL 2022 will reportedly have more than 25% of the capacity crowds at the venues. The tournament will be held from March 26 to May 29 across four venues in two cities of Maharashtra, Mumbai and Pune. It has also been reported that going ahead the stadiums will have more fans than the initial matches.

5.title: Abhishek being harassed by Centre: TMC as ED questions him
5.article_body: After TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee was questioned by Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case linked to Bengal coal scam on Monday, party spokesperson Kunal Ghosh claimed Banerjee is being harassed by the union government. BJP is controlling agencies like CBI and ED, Ghosh said. He also asked why BJP's Suvendu Adhikari wasn't questioned in cases he was named in.

6.title: Don't trouble me for interviews, hard work must be silent: Pradeep to media
6.article_body: Pradeep Mehra whose video went viral has said he's being troubled by the media for interviews, adding, "It seems like I ran a few steps and I'm being praised so much, I won't be able to focus on my goal." The 19-year-old appealed to the media to not approach him, adding, "Hard work must be silent, success must be celebrated."

7.title: It cost me 8 years of mega back pain: Musk on old pic of himself sumo wrestling
7.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday took to Twitter to share an old picture of himself sumo wrestling. "Managed to throw him, but it cost me smashing my c5-c6 disc & 8 years of mega back pain! Finally fixed with c5-c6 disc fusion," Musk tweeted. Musk had earlier challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to a "single combat" for Ukraine.

8.title: Tried to pitch it up to dismiss Aus batters: Shaheen on Day 1 of 3rd Test
8.article_body: Having reduced Australia to 8/2 after three overs on Day 1 of third Test against Pakistan, Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi said he tried to pitch the ball up in right areas to dismiss opposition batters. He added that there are many chances of getting a wicket in morning session of a Test. Shaheen dismissed David Warner and Marnus Labuschagne.

9.title: Virat Kohli joins RCB bio-bubble ahead of IPL 2022, RCB share pics
9.article_body: Former RCB captain Virat Kohli joined the team bio-bubble ahead of IPL 2022. RCB took to social media to share pictures of Kohli, writing, "King Kohli has arrived! That's it. That's the news." RCB will face PBKS in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27 at DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. RCB will be led by Faf Du Plessis.

10.title: Who is Swami Sivananda, the 125-yr-old yoga guru awarded the Padma Shri?
10.article_body: Born in 1896, in Sylhet district (now in Bangladesh), Swami Sivananda practices yoga every day and eats food without oil and spices. For the last 50 years, he has been serving 400-600 leprosy-affected beggars by arranging food, clothes and other essentials for them in Puri. In an earlier interview, he said he owed his age to "yoga, discipline and celibacy".

11.title: US sanctions Sudan's police force over crackdown on protesters
11.article_body: US has placed sanctions on Sudan's Central Reserve Police, accusing it of using excessive force on anti-coup demonstrators who've been protesting against the country's military coup since October last year. "We condemn Sudan’s security services for killing, harassing, and intimidating [people]," US Treasury Department said in a statement. Over 80 people have reportedly died in protests since coup.

12.title: Portugal's Sao Jorge island hit by 90 small earthquakes in 24 hrs
12.article_body: Authorities in Portugal's Azores archipelago have said that the mid-Atlantic volcanic island of Sao Jorge was hit by nearly 90 small earthquakes in a little over 24 hours. The Azores Civil Protection authority has asked local mayors and fire units to "remain vigilant". The authority has requested an evaluation by experts from the region's volcanic surveillance centre.

13.title: Brazil Vice Prez Mourão won't be my running mate this time: Bolsonaro
13.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Monday that Vice President General Hamilton Mourão won't be his running mate in the October general elections. Bolsonaro, who will seek a second term, stated that his running mate choice will be announced formally in April. "I need a vice president that does not have the ambition of sitting in my chair," he added.

14.title: US cannot confirm Russia's use of hypersonic missiles: US official
14.article_body: A senior US defence official on Monday said the US cannot independently confirm or refute Russia's recent claim that it had used hypersonic Kinzhal missiles in Ukraine. "It could be that they're trying to send a message to the West," the official added. Russia had claimed that it had used the missiles to destroy a weapons depot in Ivano-Frankivsk region.

15.title: DC used excuse to cast non-Egyptians in 'Black Adam': Mohamed Diab
15.article_body: Mohamed Diab, the director of Marvel Studios' show 'Moon Knight', revealed he was "annoyed" with DC for creating a fictional middle eastern country as an excuse to cast non-Egyptians in 'Black Adam'. "It was...meant to be in Egypt," he added. Diab said, "It's not a full mistake since it's based on an iteration of the comics that doesn't mention Egypt."

16.title: Loyalty must be considered while naming Punjab Cong chief: Bajwa
16.article_body: Punjab Congress leader Pratap Singh Bajwa on Monday said that the appointment of the next state party chief should be based on loyalty, seniority and capability. "I leave everything to the party's high command, three factors need to be looked after," he added. Bajwa submitted his resignation as a Rajya Sabha member after being elected to the Punjab Assembly.

17.title: Indian economy better placed to deal with challenges: RBI Governor
17.article_body: Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, Shaktikanta Das on Monday said that the Indian economy is "comfortably placed to deal with any challenges with regard to financing the Current Account Deficit (CAD)". He also said that the RBI will continue to ensure liquidity to support the economy, which is facing some troubles following the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

18.title: ₹5,000 cash for those who help road accident victims in TN: CM
18.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Monday said that people who will help provide medical care facilities to road accident victims in the state will be given a cash reward of ₹5,000. CM Stalin had earlier launched 'Innuyir Kaappon', a scheme providing free medical treatment within the first 48 hours to those injured in road accidents.

19.title: The journey made me better: Rubina on marital issues with Abhinav
19.article_body: Television actress Rubina Dilaik, speaking about her marital issues with husband actor Abhinav Shukla, said that the journey made her a better person. The couple had earlier spoken about facing tough times and contemplating divorce on 'Bigg Boss 14'. "Being on the biggest reality show, we gave...access to people to judge us and also peek into our lives," she added.

20.title: Growth impact of Ukraine crisis should be marginal for India: RBI Governor
20.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor, Shaktikanta Das, on Monday said the growth impact of the Russia-Ukraine crisis should be marginal for India. He further said he does not see a situation in India where inflation remains above the 2% to 6% band for extended period. Das was addressing industrialists at the National Council Meeting of the CII.

21.title: Warner has shown greatness, will have point to prove in IPL 2022: Karthik
21.article_body: Picking David Warner as the player to watch out for in upcoming IPL, Dinesh Karthik said the DC batter has shown greatness in IPL over a period of time. He added that Warner will have a "point to prove" as his last year with SRH didn't go according to plan. Notably, the Australian opener is fifth-highest run-scorer in IPL history.

22.title: Suspected attackers kill at least 13 soldiers in Burkina Faso: Army
22.article_body: Burkina Faso military on Monday said suspected Islamic militants killed at least 13 soldiers and injured eight others in Burkina Faso's eastern Gourma province on March 20. The army added that a number of armed attackers were killed in the incident. This comes as the army has been conducting large-scale operations to regain territories that were lost to the militants.

23.title: India managed Omicron variant 23 times better than other countries: Govt
23.article_body: Health Ministry’s Lav Agarwal on Monday said that India managed the COVID-19 Omicron variant "23 times better" as compared to other countries in the world. He added, "We gave QR coded digital certificates to every citizen for every COVID-19 dose delivered. We have not leveraged technology, we have leveraged human resources in this country, which worked with commitment."

24.title: India puts Boeing 737 fleets under 'enhanced surveillance' after China plane crash
24.article_body: After a Boeing 737 aircraft of China Eastern Airlines carrying 132 passengers crashed in Guangxi on Monday, India's civil aviation regulator placed the Boeing 737 fleets of Indian carriers under "enhanced surveillance". DGCA chief said the authority was taking "a number of initiatives" after the tragedy. SpiceJet, Vistara and Air India Express have Boeing 737 aircraft in their fleets.

25.title: Employees' PF interest rate cut reflects today's realities: Nirmala Sitharaman
25.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke about the lowering of interest on the Employees' Provident Fund from 8.5% to 8.1% for 2021-22. She said, "EPFO's central board has representatives from different stakeholders who have taken this call...It had been 40 years since the rate wasn't brought down." She added, "There are today's realities that keep us in context with the decisions."

26.title: Loved 'Badhaai Do', an important story told brilliantly: Samantha
26.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu has praised Bhumi Pednekar and Rajkummar Rao-starrer 'Badhaai Do'. Taking to Instagram Stories on Monday, she wrote, "Absolutely loved Badhaai Do. An important story told brilliantly with outstanding performances." In the film, Bhumi played a lesbian physical education teacher, whereas, Rajkummar played the role of a gay policeman. "Love is love," Samantha added.

27.title: Guj shopkeeper who consumed acid after killing 17-yr-old girl dies
27.article_body: A 21-year-old shopkeeper, who allegedly strangled a 17-year-old girl to death in a Gujarat hotel before consuming acid, has died in hospital, police said on Monday. The two were reportedly in a relationship and had checked into the hotel before the incident. The investigation is still on and forensic report to ascertain cause of girl's death is awaited, police said.

28.title: I said counsel him, not cancel him: Trevor after Kanye's attack on him
28.article_body: Television talk show host Trevor Noah on Sunday tweeted, "I said counsel Kanye, not cancel Kanye." This comes after rapper Kanye West was barred from performing at the Grammy Awards 2022 due to his "concerning online behaviour". Kanye had directed a racial attack on Trevor after he criticised the rapper saying that he was harassing his ex-wife Kim Kardashian.

29.title: I see leadership qualities in all: Shreyas in first address as KKR captain
29.article_body: Giving his introductory speech as KKR skipper ahead of IPL 2022, Shreyas Iyer said he sees the leadership qualities in each and every player of the team. "We need to care for each other as a team because there will be tough times...let us try and create that formidable relationship on and off...field and propel on the field," he stated.

30.title: Crypto mining cost not to be allowed as deduction under Income Tax Act: Govt
30.article_body: The infrastructure cost incurred in the mining of cryptocurrencies or any Virtual Digital Assets (VDA) won't be allowed as a deduction under the Income Tax Act, MoS for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. He said the government will come out with a definition of VDA with a view to levy 30% tax on income from the transfer of such assets.

31.title: 190 industries polluting Ganga shut down, 165 not complying: Govt
31.article_body: Minister of State for Jal Shakti Bishweswar Tudu on Monday said that out of the 1,080 industries causing pollution in Ganga, 190 have been closed while 165 are still not complying with norms. About 280.17 million litres per day (MLD) effluents are being discharged into river Ganga main stem having a BOD load of 9.68 tons per day, Tudu added.

32.title: A producer once said 'Do you think you're Madhuri Dixit?': Gauahar
32.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan has revealed that a producer once told her, "Tumhe kya lagta hai, tum Madhuri Dixit ho (What do you think, you are Madhuri Dixit)?" The actress further said that another producer took her date of birth and called ten days later to say, "You'll never become an actress...If you do, you'll only do shady and sidey roles."

33.title: 'The Kashmir Files' creating situation that may harm India: Yechury
33.article_body: Reacting to 'The Kashmir Files', CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury said the film is creating a situation that may cause "great harm" to India's social unity and integrity. Yechury added that his party was the first to speak out against the plight of Kashmiri Pandits in 1990, with its MLAs addressing the issue in the former Jammu and Kashmir Legislative Assembly.

34.title: Cong doesn't politicise religion or caste: Kharge on Azad's remark
34.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said on Monday that the party doesn't engage in politicising religion or caste and added that no other party should do it either. Kharge's remark came a day after fellow Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said that all parties divide people on a religious and caste basis, which Kharge has termed Azad's "personal view".

35.title: Two trains collide in Tunisian capital, 95 people injured: Govt
35.article_body: Tunisian authorities on Monday said 95 people were injured as two trains collided in capital Tunis. Civil Defence Spokesman Moez Triaa said the injured were rushed to hospital and that no deaths occurred during the accident. He added that only one train carried passengers. In 2016, at least five people were killed after a train slammed into a public bus.

36.title: It's going to top the first one: Angela Bassett on 'Black Panther 2'
36.article_body: Actress Angela Bassett, speaking about her upcoming film 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever', has said, "It's going to be amazing. It's going to top [the first] one." Angela remembered late actor Chadwick Boseman, who played the lead in the 2018 film 'Black Panther' and called him a leader and an amazing talent. "We just hope to raise his standard," she added.

37.title: I search for films to direct which aren't easy to mount: Ajay Devgn
37.article_body: Talking about directing films, Ajay Devgn said, "When I want to make a film, I search for films which are not easy to mount." Ajay further stated creating new visuals for his upcoming film 'Runway 34' was difficult as the film is set on the ground and air. "It was also exciting," he added. The film also stars Amitabh Bachchan.

38.title: Hardik is a very interesting choice: Karthik on GT captain
38.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he's keen to see how new franchise Gujarat Titans perform in upcoming IPL, calling their captain Hardik Pandya an "interesting choice". He added that Hardik has all the "flamboyance" and it remains to be seen whether he can transfer that into his teammates. "He's going to be in a good nick," Karthik further said.

39.title: No proposal to increase funds allocated under MPLAD Scheme: Govt
39.article_body: There is no proposal to increase the funds allocated to each MP under the Members of Parliament Local Area Development (MPLAD) Scheme, the Centre informed the Rajya Sabha on Monday. Union Minister of State Rao Inderjit Singh made the announcement in a written reply to a query raised by Kerala Congress (M) MP Jose K Mani.

40.title: Joined military school at 18, was taught how to seduce targets: Ex-Russian spy
40.article_body: A 37-year-old woman revealed that she was a former Russian spy who was taught how to seduce and manipulate targets at a military school that she had joined at the age of 18. Speaking about the Ukraine war, Aliia Roza said Russian President Vladimir Putin "will go till the end". Roza now lives in the US and works in PR.

41.title: SBSP on wrong track with Samajwadi Party: BJP leader
41.article_body: UP BJP Vice President Daya Shankar Singh said Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) is on the "wrong track" with the Samajwadi Party. He added that only BJP can help SBSP achieve its goals. Singh also said SBSP chief OP Rajbhar has been raising issues of the most backward communities and BJP works for taking the weaker sections ahead.

42.title: Putin's 'lover' hiding with their secret kids in Swiss villa, says online petition
42.article_body: A petition on change.org has sought the expulsion of former Russian gymnast Alina Kabaeva from Switzerland, amid Ukraine's invasion. The petition alleged that the 38-year-old is a lover of Russian President Vladimir Putin and is 'hiding' with their 'secret children' in a luxury villa. "Despite the current war, Switzerland continues to host an accomplice of Putin's regime," said the petition.

43.title: At least 925 civilians killed, 1,496 injured in Ukraine: UN
43.article_body: Office of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Monday said at least 925 civilians were killed in Ukraine as of midnight on March 20 since Russia invaded Ukraine. The office added that most of the fatalities were from heavy artillery shelling, multiple-launch rocket systems, missiles and airstrikes. However, OHCHR said the actual death toll might be considerably higher.

44.title: Pakistan win a Women's World Cup game for the first time since 2009
44.article_body: Pakistan defeated West Indies today to win a match in Women's World Cup for the first time since 2009. Before this match, Pakistan had lost 18 matches in a row in Women's World Cups. The match was reduced to 20 overs per side, with West Indies putting up a total of 89/7. Pakistan chased down the target in 18.5 overs.

45.title: India's crude oil imports from Russia are minuscule: Petroleum Minister
45.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas, Hardeep Singh Puri, on Monday addressed the impact of Russia-Ukraine conflict on the import of crude oil and said that India's oil imports from Russia are "minuscule". He told the Rajya Sabha, "We require a total of 5 million barrels per day. That's our (crude oil) consumption...60% of it comes from the Gulf."

46.title: Chinese plane that crashed lost 26,000 feet in under 3 minutes, shows data
46.article_body: The China Eastern Airlines flight carrying 132 people, which crashed on Monday, was cruising at an altitude of 29,100 feet at 06:20:43 GMT, according to data from flight-tracking service Flightradar24. The Boeing 737 aircraft had descended to 9,150 feet at 6:21:40 GMT. At 6:22:35 GMT, the flight's altitude was 3,225 feet, according to Flightradar24.

47.title: He's like a family member: Pant on DC head coach Ponting
47.article_body: DC skipper Rishabh Pant said it's always special to meet head coach Ricky Ponting, adding it's like meeting a "family member". He added, "Whenever he comes to the field he brings that energy out of everyone. Everyone looks up to him like he's gonna say something different." Under Ponting, DC reached the IPL play-offs for third consecutive time last season.

48.title: Skeleton of 27-yr-old man found during ploughing of farmland in MP
48.article_body: A skeleton belonging to a 27-year-old man was found during the ploughing of sugarcane farmland in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur district on Monday, police said. The deceased, Hemraj Kahar, went missing from his house on March 8, following which a complaint was filed by his wife. According to police, it appears to be a prima facie case of murder.

49.title: I'm trapped in beard, long hair over continuity of projects: Anil George
49.article_body: Actor Anil George has stated that he is trapped in his look of beard and long hair due to a continuity of projects, adding that he wants to experiment. "Makers want me in such looks and audience too loves it," he added. The actor further said that he had to forgo an Abbas-Mustan film due to the look.

50.title: Ajay a lavish producer, he made ₹32cr film in times of ₹8-10cr budget: Rohit
50.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty has called actor-producer Ajay Devgn a lavish producer, adding that he made 2000 film 'Raju Chacha' with a budget of ₹32 crore when normal budgets were ₹8-10 crore. "He is technically one of the most sound persons in the industry...['Runway 34] has another kind of visuals," the filmmaker added. Ajay has directed and stars in the film.

51.title: I will only help those who voted for me: UP BJP MLA Dinesh Rawat
51.article_body: BJP MLA Dinesh Rawat, who won from Uttar Pradesh's Haidergarh constituency, said, "These people should not come to me for any kind of help. I will help only those who have voted for me." Rawat said this while addressing a gathering on Holi and it came to light when a video of the event surfaced online.

52.title: US-based CommerceIQ turns unicorn with $115 million funding
52.article_body: Retail e-commerce management platform CommerceIQ has closed a $115 million Series D funding round at a valuation of over $1 billion, achieving unicorn status. The round was led by SoftBank Vision Fund 2 and included participation from Insight Partners, Trinity Ventures, Shasta Ventures and Madrona Venture Group. Based in California, US, CommerceIQ also has offices in Seattle and Bengaluru.

53.title: 125-year-old Swami Sivananda kneels before PM while receiving Padma Shri
53.article_body: UP-based yoga guru Swami Sivananda knelt before PM Narendra Modi even as the latter bowed before him with folded hands during the Padma awards ceremony on Monday. A video of 125-year-old Sivananda receiving the Padma Shri has been released by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting. Sivananda also knelt before President Ram Nath Kovind before receiving the honour.

54.title: Russian court bans Facebook and Instagram, classifies Meta as 'extremist'
54.article_body: A Russian court on Monday banned Facebook and Instagram in the country after classifying their parent company Meta Platforms as an "extremist" organisation. The ban does not include WhatsApp, Russia's TASS news agency reported. Russia had earlier blocked access to Instagram after Meta said it would allow Ukrainian users to post messages urging violence against Russian President Vladimir Putin.

55.title: Danish Siddiqui's parents to take legal action against Taliban over his death
55.article_body: Parents of photojournalist Danish Siddiqui, who was killed in Afghanistan last year during an assignment, will initiate legal action and move the International Criminal Court against the Taliban over Danish's death. Siddiqui was covering clashes between Afghan troops and the Taliban. "Danish was illegally detained, tortured and killed by the Taliban," said his family in a statement.

56.title: Putin must not win war in Ukraine: Estonian PM Kaja Kallas
56.article_body: Condemning the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Estonian PM Kaja Kallas has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "must not win this war". Kallas, who termed Russia's actions "heartbreaking", stated that NATO countries are doing all they can to support Ukraine. Kallas added that NATO's strategy should focus on ending war by moving from a "deterrence posture" to a "defence posture".

57.title: Germany, United Arab Emirates sign climate-friendly energy deals
57.article_body: German Minister of Economics and Climate Protection Robert Habeck on Monday said German firms signed five agreements related to hydrogen research and development with companies from the United Arab Emirates (UAE). As per the ministry, German firms, Abu Dhabi National Oil Company and Japan's JERA will undertake a joint demonstration project for hydrogen transport.

58.title: ASEAN's special envoy begins trip to Myanmar, meets junta chief
58.article_body: A special envoy from ASEAN, Prak Sokhonn, met with Myanmar's junta chief Min Aung Hlaing on Monday during his mission to facilitate the start of a dialogue between the military and opponents of its coup. Prak and Hlaing discussed "the situation of protests and violence stemming from political disagreement", an official statement said. The envoy's visit will end on Wednesday.

59.title: Most Russian forces remain over 25 kilometres from centre of Kyiv: UK
59.article_body: UK Ministry of Defence on Monday said bulk of Russian forces remain more than 25 kilometres from centre of Ukrainian capital Kyiv. "Heavy fighting continues north of Kyiv," stated military intelligence update from the ministry. The ministry added that Kyiv remains Russia's primary military objective and they are likely to prioritise attempting to encircle the city over the coming weeks.

60.title: Late CDS Gen Bipin Rawat awarded Padma Vibhushan, his daughters receive honour
60.article_body: India's first Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat, who died in a helicopter crash in December 2021, was awarded the Padma Vibhushan posthumously on Monday. His daughters Kritika and Tarini received the award from President Ram Nath Kovind on their father's behalf. General Rawat's wife and 12 others were also killed in the same crash.

61.title: Preparing for most exciting role of my life: Anil as Sonam announces pregnancy
61.article_body: After actress Sonam Kapoor shared pictures from her maternity shoot as a way of announcing her pregnancy, her father Anil Kapoor tweeted, "Now preparing for the most exciting role of my life- Grandfather!" He added, "Our lives will never be the same again...I couldn't be more grateful! Sonam, Anand you've made us happy beyond measure with this incredible news."

62.title: Shahid Afridi is my favourite player, after that Shaheen: Nida Dar
62.article_body: Pakistan Women all-rounder Nida Dar said Shahid Afridi and Shaheen Shah Afridi are her top two favourite players. "So I celebrate like them," she added. Nida registered 4/10 to help her side claim their first win in ongoing Women's World Cup after defeating West Indies. Notably, Nida is the first Pakistani cricketer, male or female, to bag 100 T20I wickets.

63.title: Not invited to Oscars: Best Picture nominee West Side Story's Rachel Zegler
63.article_body: Actress Rachel Zegler, who is the lead actress of Oscar's Best Picture nominee 'West Side Story', has revealed that she has not been invited to the ceremony. She had responded to a fan's comment about her outfit at the ceremony. A fan commented, "So not fair," while another wrote, "How’s the leading actress of a movie....up for seven...awards not invited?"

64.title: PhonePe acquires Pune-based micro-entrepreneur platform GigIndia
64.article_body: Walmart-owned PhonePe on Monday announced that it has acquired Pune-based GigIndia, a network for freelance micro-entrepreneurs. PhonePe did not reveal the financial details of the deal. As part of the acquisition, GigIndia will be integrated with the digital payments platform. GigIndia has 1.5 million entrepreneurs and over 100 enterprises as customers, the company said in its press release.

65.title: No fears of 'stagflation' in India: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das
65.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "With regard to the prospect of stagflation, whether it is a risk for India, in our assessment I think such prospects don't exist." He added, "India is far away from such a grim prospect." 'Stagflation' is when there's slow economic growth and relatively high unemployment, which is at the same time accompanied by rising prices.

66.title: UP among 3 poorest states as per NITI Aayog’s ranking: Akhilesh
66.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said under the BJP government, Uttar Pradesh is among the three poorest states in India as per NITI Aayog's multidimensional poverty index. "[UP] ranks third in terms of malnutrition rate," Yadav said. Adding that UP ranks last in the child and adolescent mortality rate category, he said, "These are the badges of failure of BJP government."

67.title: Indonesia ends quarantine requirement for international arrivals
67.article_body: Indonesia has removed its quarantine requirement for all international arrivals, Indonesian Tourism Minister Sandiaga Uno announced on Monday. The decision comes after a quarantine waiver for vaccinated visitors to the islands of Bali, Batam, and Bintan was implemented earlier this month. A negative RT-PCR test will still be required to enter the country, Uno added.

68.title: Andrew reacts to 'No Way Home' not getting Oscar best film nomination
68.article_body: After 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' did not receive an Oscar nomination in the Best Picture category, actor Andrew Garfield has said that he's "pretty satisfied" with the audience's response to the film. "I mean, it's the sixth biggest movie in the history of movies...I think that's plenty," he added. The film received an Oscar nomination in the Visual Effects category.

69.title: Smokes from wildfires can destroy Earth's ozone layer: Study
69.article_body: Canadian study stated that smokes from wildfires can destroy Earth's ozone layer. In its observations on Australian wildfires, lead author Peter Bernath said fires injected acidic smoke particles into stratosphere which converted ozone-regulating compounds into more reactive compounds that destroy ozone. Team used data from Canadian Space Agency's Atmospheric Chemistry Experiment (ACE) satellite.

70.title: Hyd Police give clean chit to TRS leader's son in accident case
70.article_body: Hyderabad Police have given clean chit to Telangana Rashtra Samithi's (TRS) Bodhan MLA Mohammed Shakir Amir’s son Raheel Amir in an accident case, which killed an infant last Thursday. Raheel's 19-year-old cousin Syed Afnan Ahmed was driving the car which hit street vendors in Jubilee Hills, police said. Police also ruled out possibility of Afnan driving under influence of alcohol.

71.title: Pramod Sawant to continue as Goa Chief Minister for 2nd term
71.article_body: Goa's caretaker CM Pramod Sawant has been chosen as the CM of the state for a second term, days after BJP won 20 seats in the 40-member Goa assembly. Notably, this will be the third straight term of the BJP in Goa. Reports suggest that the swearing-in ceremony of the new government will tentatively take place between March 23-25.

72.title: 'Lagaan' inspired me to make a story on human emotions: Rajamouli
72.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli has revealed that he was inspired by Aamir Khan-starrer 2001 film 'Lagaan' to make a story based on basic human emotions. "The way the entire country connected with 'Lagaan' made a big impression on me," he added. Rajamouli further said 'Lagaan' was the first film to be accepted across India and it was only made in Hindi.

73.title: Archaeologists discover 4,000-year-old ancient tombs in Egypt
73.article_body: Egyptian Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities on Saturday announced that archaeologists discovered five 4,000-year-old ancient tombs in Saqqara sites southwest of Cairo. As per the ministry, the tombs contained artefacts dating back to the Old Kingdom, a period spanning roughly from around 2700 BC to 2200 BC. The officials added that tombs belonged to regional rulers and palace supervisors.

74.title: Rachakonda Police to provide free police recruitment training
74.article_body: The official Twitter handle of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police shared that the Commissioner of Police is planning to provide free police recruitment training to the poor, middle-class unemployed persons. The post further said that it will help them work hard to get jobs. "Staff...instructed to exercise restraint to set up free coaching centers as soon as...notification was issued," it added.

75.title: Hyd Police urges people to report drugs supply, sale information
75.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Monday took to Twitter to urge people to share any type of information regarding the supply, sale, transportation or cultivation of marijuana and other narcotics. The force shared the appeal with the caption, "Bury the drugs or [they'll] bury you soon." The post said the identity of the person who reports the information would be kept confidential.

76.title: EU Foreign Ministers discuss sanctions against Russian oil, gas
76.article_body: EU Foreign Ministers on Monday discussed imposing sanctions on Russian oil and gas sector. While ministers of Lithuania and Ireland said EU must impose sanctions against the Russian energy sector, countries such as Germany, Netherlands which are heavily dependent on Russian gas warned against an embargo on Russian energy imports. Notably, EU relies on Russia for 40% of its gas.

77.title: China is considering $2.5 bn in financial aid for Sri Lanka: Envoy
77.article_body: Qi Zhenhong, the Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, on Monday said that China is considering a request for financial assistance from the South Asian nation. Sri Lanka has sought a $1 billion loan and a $1.5 billion credit line, he added. The request comes amid a severe economic crisis that has led to shortages of essential items in the country.

78.title: 'Race 1' was the best out of all films in the franchise: Bipasha
78.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu said that the 2008 film 'Race' was the best film of the franchise. "It was an amazing thriller and Abbas-Mustan directing the film made it even better because they are excellent with thrillers," she added. This comes as the film completed 14 years of its release on Monday. "The energy on the sets was palpable," Bipasha stated.

79.title: After PMC & PCMC, Pune Zilla Parishad to come under state govt
79.article_body: After Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC), Pune Zilla Parishad will now come under the state government, as the tenure of the elected members ended on Sunday. "The tenure of the elected members ended on Sunday and now the state government would be in charge of the policy decisions," said Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad.

80.title: Pune man kills 24-yr-old wife for not bearing child, arrested
80.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a 30-year-old man who allegedly strangulated his 24-year-old wife to death for not bearing a child. The incident took place at the Vetalnagar area of Ambegaon Budruk on March 18. Police said the accused Devanand Kalel told them that his wife Kajal had died by suicide, however, the post-mortem revealed that it was murder.

81.title: Deeply shocked & saddened: PM after Chinese plane with 132 people crashes
81.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday took to Twitter after a Chinese plane with 132 passengers crashed into the mountains on Monday. He wrote, "Deeply shocked and saddened to learn about the crash of the passenger flight MU5735 with 132 on board in China’s Guangxi. Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims of the crash and their family members."

82.title: Chinese flight lost altitude very fast, descended steeply on vertical trajectory
82.article_body: The China Eastern Airlines flight carrying 132 people, that crashed in a mountainous area near the city of Wuzhou on Monday, lost altitude very fast, according to real-time flight tracking service Flightradar24. Radar tracking also showed that the Boeing 737 plane descended steeply on an almost vertical trajectory. The flight was travelling from Kunming to Guangzhou.

83.title: 20-yr-old Swiatek wins her 5th women's singles title, becomes world no. 2
83.article_body: Poland's Iga Swiatek defeated Greece's Maria Sakkari in straight sets to clinch the women's singles title at the Indian Wells on Sunday. With this win, the 20-year-old champion secured her fifth career title and moved up to the second spot in the world rankings. "It's pretty crazy because I wasn't expecting to be in...final," Swiatek said.

84.title: Pune’s St Mira’s College holds TEDx with theme ‘Magic of Risks’
84.article_body: Pune's St Mira's College for Girls hosted the third edition of TEDx after a long COVID-19 break. The theme for the event, which was organised by Sarah Kinariwala, mentored by Professor Abhradita Chatterjee Nahvi and supported by Principal In-charge Dr Jaya Rajagopalan, CWE co-ordinator Dr Rama Venkatachalam and Team CWE, was "Magic of Risks."

85.title: Venkatesh is a team man, always talks about winning: KKR skipper Shreyas
85.article_body: Praising Venkatesh Iyer, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said the batter is a team man and always talks about winning. "That's the type of character we need in our team, one who is ready to go out there...show that relentlessness," he added. Talking about Venkatesh's batting spot in the team, Shreyas said that he's very flexible at any position.

86.title: If I'm home, nobody asks why I'm not at work: Shefali Shah on sexism
86.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has revealed that if she is at home and hasn't gone to work, nobody asks her why she hasn't gone. "But...I...ask [my husband filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah], 'Why are you not going to office today?'" she added. The actress further said that it has been years of conditioning that women stay home and husbands go to work.

87.title: Mumbai builder booked for continuing construction work after 10 pm
87.article_body: Mumbai-based Mahavir Developers has been reportedly booked for continuing construction work after 10 pm in violation of noise pollution norms. This comes after Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey issued strict noise pollution guidelines to infrastructure firms. According to guidelines, Bombay High Court orders are to be followed, including carrying out construction work only between 6 am to 10 pm.

88.title: Channi meets Punjab CM Mann in 1st meeting since Assembly polls
88.article_body: Former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi met and congratulated the state's new CM Bhagwant Mann in Chandigarh on Monday. This is Channi's first meeting with CM Bhagwant Mann after the Assembly election results were announced on March 10. Channi lost the elections from both Assembly seats of Bhadaur and Chamkaur Sahib, where he had contested from.

89.title: Sanctions on Russia are like weapons of mass destruction: Raghuram Rajan
89.article_body: Sanctions imposed on Russia in the wake of the Russia-Ukraine war are like "weapons of mass destruction", former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said. "They may not topple buildings or collapse bridges but they destroy firms, financial institutions, livelihoods, and even lives," Rajan said. If not governed properly, sanctions could disturb the global financial order, he added.

90.title: Admission to DU's minority colleges might be based on CUET scores
90.article_body: Admissions to Delhi University's minority colleges, including St. Stephen's College and Jesus and Mary College, among others, could be based on the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores from the next academic year. Around 50% of the seats in various courses offered by minority colleges are reserved for students belonging to specific minority communities.

91.title: Glad to be part of new IPL team, build it from scratch: KL Rahul on LSG
91.article_body: KL Rahul, who will be leading Lucknow Super Giants in upcoming IPL after moving from Punjab Kings, said he's glad to be part of a new franchise and build it from scratch. "I have never sat in meetings discussing each and every player, how we want to set up the franchise...there is so much that has happened," he added.

92.title: 3 men stab man in neck in Gurugram after meeting him to end dispute
92.article_body: The Gurugram Police have booked three people for allegedly slitting the throat of a friend after a meeting to end an old dispute went wrong on Holi. According to the victim, he met the accused on Holi to resolve an old dispute. However, they had an argument again, following which Naresh (accused) stabbed him in the neck.

93.title: I'll be stupid not to do web series, finalising debut project: Daisy
93.article_body: Actress Daisy Shah has stated that the webspace has boomed amazingly, adding that she will be "really stupid" not to be open to doing a web series. "I've got a few offers. I'm still finalising on what I'll make my debut with," the actress said. Daisy added that web series have opened up a lot of job opportunities for everyone.

94.title: You've shown remarkable grit: PM Modi to Lakshya on All England silver
94.article_body: Following Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen's runner-up finish at 2022 All England Championships, PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter and wrote, "Proud of you Lakshya! You've shown remarkable grit and tenacity. He added, "You put up a spirited fight...I'm confident you'll keep scaling new heights of success." Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "There're no failures in life. You either win or you learn,"

95.title: Manipur CM lists govt's 3 priorities after taking oath for 2nd term
95.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Monday listed his government's three priorities after taking oath for his second consecutive term as Chief Minister. He said his government's "primary duty [is to] wash out corruption from the state". He added that his second and third priorities are to "wash out any kind of drug-related matter" and bring "insurgents...to the negotiating table".

96.title: Great Barrier Reef suffers bleaching due to ocean warming: Report
96.article_body: Climate Council, an Australian environmental group on Monday said the Great Barrier Reef is at risk of bleaching as ocean temperatures have increased by two to four degrees Celsius above average. Report added that the reef has suffered three mass bleaching events in past six years. This comes as a UN team is due to assess reef's World Heritage listing.

97.title: Deep-sea pipeline in Maharashtra's Palghar to be ready in 2 months
97.article_body: A deep-sea pipeline at Tarapur MIDC, being constructed to carry treated industrial effluents about 7 km away from high-tide line at Navapur beach in Maharashtra's Palghar district, will be operational within next two months, according to officials. The existing concrete pipeline that is operational since 1970s, suffers from frequent leaks, a Tarapur Environment Protection Society official said.

98.title: B'luru Traffic Police educates 2-wheeler riders about helmets
98.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Monday educated two-wheeler riders about wearing high-quality helmets. Pictures shared by the force show officers holding helmets and talking to the riders, while some riders posed with helmets provided by officers. The force also posted a video to raise awareness about helmets wherein it said that motorbike riders should wear a helmet bearing the ISI mark.

99.title: China Eastern Airlines' site turns black & white after crash as sign of respect
99.article_body: After the crash of its plane carrying 132 passengers, the website of  China Eastern Airlines turned black and white, a step airlines take in response to a crash as a sign of respect for the victims. The 737-800 aircraft crashed in southwest China on Monday, leading to a mountain fire while the number of casualties remain unknown.

100.title: Punjab Vidhan Sabha proceedings will now be telecast live: CM Mann
100.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Monday said proceedings of the state's Vidhan Sabha will now be telecast live. In his maiden address after Kultar Singh Sandhwan's unanimous election as the Vidhan Sabha Speaker, Mann said, "From now on, nobody will need to make a video without permission and face Privilege proceedings. The media will also get audio and videos."

101.title: Russian shelling kills at least 8 in Kyiv's Podil district: Report
101.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General on Monday said at least eight were killed on Sunday in Kyiv's Podil district due to shelling by Russian forces. As per Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko, several homes and a shopping mall were hit too. Meanwhile, UN said at least 902 civilians were killed and 1,459 others were injured in Ukraine from February 24 to March 19.

102.title: 13 NATO warships headed to Sweden amid bloc's drills in Norway: Report
102.article_body: As many as 13 warships from several NATO member countries were headed to Sweden's Frihamnen Port on Sunday amid bloc's "Cold Response 2022" military drills in Norway, Swedish media reported. The warships reportedly include nine German vessels. While the drills are being conducted amid Russia-Ukraine tensions, it was planned months prior and isn't related to the invasion, NATO has said.

103.title: China reports 2,027 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
103.article_body: Chinese authorities said the country reported 2,027 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday, up from 1,737 from the previous day. As per China's National Health Commission, out of 2,027 cases, 1,947 were locally transmitted infections and 80 were imported ones. The authorities added that Jilin province recorded the highest number of infections with 1,542 cases.

104.title: Scientists find new form of ice that may be found on distant planets
104.article_body: US researchers discovered a new form of ice that may be found on moons and water-rich planets outside our solar system. The team squeezed the water sample between the tips of two diamonds and further subjected the resulting ice crystals to laser heating. Scientists observed the gradual transition from water to ice due to pressure raising and laser heating.

105.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami named as Uttarakhand CM
105.article_body: Uttarakhand's caretaker CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has been chosen as the new state CM after BJP won 47 seats in the 70-member Assembly in the recently-concluded elections. Dhami had lost the Khatima seat to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri, who won by a margin of over 6,500 votes. Dhami had earlier taken charge as CM in July 2021.

106.title: Spain welcomed 25,000 Ukrainian refugees so far: Migration Minister
106.article_body: Spanish Migration Minister José Luis Escrivá on Monday said that about 25,000 Ukrainian refugees have arrived in Spain since Russia launched its invasion on February 24. Around 9,000 of them have registered themselves with the Spanish authorities, he added. Many of the Ukrainians who have arrived are staying with relatives or friends, Escrivá further said.

107.title: I'm at fault: Real Madrid manager Ancelotti after 4-0 loss vs Barca
107.article_body: Following a 4-0 loss against Barcelona, Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti said that his side was unrecognisable during the match and added everything went wrong for them. "We have to forget...and move forward, we have a big lead [in La Liga]. I...am at fault," he stated. Despite the loss, Real Madrid are on top of the La Liga points table.

108.title: 3 people selling 30 kg ivory tusks caught by police in Bengaluru
108.article_body: Three people selling ivory tusks weighing around 30 kgs were caught by police in Bengaluru. The arrests were reportedly made by the CK Acchukattu Police Station officers based on a tip-off. The tusks were believed to be of a well-grown 40 to 45-year-old elephant and were said to be worth ₹15-25 lakh per kg in the international market.

109.title: Video claims to show Chinese plane carrying 132 people 'nosedive' in final seconds
109.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that claims to show the China Eastern Airlines aircraft carrying 132 people - 123 passengers and 9 crew - "nosedive" before crashing into the mountains. Earlier, flight tracking website FlightRadar24 showed that the plane descended steeply on an almost vertical trajectory. The Boeing 737 aircraft was travelling from Kunming to Guangzhou.

110.title: Kannada language exam must for Karnataka crime officer's post
110.article_body: Karnataka State Police Department has made the Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) Kannada language qualification mandatory for those applying for the Scene of Crime Office (SoCO) post. The decision was taken after candidates complained that there is no language requirement, allowing Karnataka residents to apply. The position requires applicants to have a forensic degree or diploma.

111.title: David Beckham hands Instagram account to Ukrainian doctor to raise awareness
111.article_body: David Beckham has handed control of his Instagram account with 71.6 million followers to a Ukrainian doctor. In a video posted on Sunday, Beckham said he wanted to highlight the "amazing work" of medical staff operating amid the Russian invasion. On Sunday, Dr Iryna, through Beckham's Stories, shared visuals of healthcare facilities being provided in a basement amid the war.

112.title: I'd love to come back as Aunt May, be part of multiverse: Marisa Tomei
112.article_body: Actress Marisa Tomei, who portrays Peter Parker's Aunt May in the 'Spider-Man' films, has said that she would love to make another appearance in Marvel films and be a part of the multiverse. Her character was killed in Tom Holland-starrer 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. "May Parker hooks up with Ant-Man...There are more avenues to explore," Marisa added.

113.title: Maharashtra Min Nawab Malik's judicial custody extended till Apr 4
113.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's judicial custody has been extended till April 4 by the special PMLA (Prevention of Money Laundering Act) court on Monday. The court also allowed Malik to be provided with a bed, mattress, and chair during the period of custody. Notably, Malik was arrested in connection with a money laundering case related to fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim.

114.title: Loss in one crypto can't be set off against income in another one: Govt
114.article_body: Loss from the transfer of a virtual digital asset (VDA) will not be allowed to set off against income arising from transfer of another VDA, the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, told the Lok Sabha on Monday. He also clarified that infrastructure costs incurred in crypto mining won't be treated as cost of acquisition, but as capital expenditure.

115.title: Rishi Kapoor wasn't self-obsessed, he was cool & calm: Juhi Chawla
115.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla has said that late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor was not self-obsessed like a lot of actors, adding that he was cool and calm. "There was no half-hearted take with him because he got the 'sur' (note) of his part," the actress added. She further said that when he looked his co-star in the eye, he wasn't acting.

116.title: Surat has soil, climate conditions similar to Mumbai: CSK's Fleming
116.article_body: Chennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming said that his side is training in Surat because it offers similar red soil and climate conditions to Mumbai. "To have this ground to ourselves and be able to have open wickets and long net sessions have been...valuable," he stated. CSK will begin their IPL 2022 campaign against KKR on March 26.

117.title: China Eastern to ground all its Boeing 737-800 jets after recent crash: Report
117.article_body: After China Eastern Airlines Boeing 737- 800 with 132 people on board crashed on Monday, the airline has grounded all of its Boeing 737-800 passenger flights from Tuesday, reported Chinese media. China Eastern reportedly has 109 of the 737-800s in its fleet. China's airline industry has a good safety record, with its last major accident taking place 12 years ago.

118.title: World bows down to hard work: 19-yr-old Pradeep seen running at night in viral clip
118.article_body: Pradeep Mehra, who inspired many after filmmaker Vinod Kapri shared a video of him running in Noida at night, when asked to give a message to the world, said, "The world bows down to hard work." After the video went viral, Kapri said to the 19-year-old, "People from the Army also called. They want to speak with you."

119.title: Switzerland must freeze Russian oligarchs' assets, says Poland's PM
119.article_body: During a visit by Swiss President Ignazio Cassis to Poland on Monday, Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki said that Switzerland must freeze accounts of Russian oligarchs in the country and confiscate their assets. In response, Cassis said that Switzerland had adopted European Union sanctions against hundreds of people, including many oligarchs. Western countries have imposed numerous sanctions on Russia.

120.title: AIMIM is working at the behest of BJP: Mallikarjun Kharge
120.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has accused AIMIM of working at the behest of BJP and has rejected any possibilities of an alliance with the Asaduddin Owaisi-led political outfit. "Congress has not received any proposal (of an alliance)," Kharge said. He added that "there is a need to be cautious of such parties which attempt to defeat secular parties".

121.title: Junior Artistes said 'Bharat Mata ki jai' after each take: 'The Kashmir...' actor
121.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' actor Chinmay Mandlekar said junior artistes in the film said 'Bharat Mata ki Jai' after each take during the shooting of a mob scene that involved raising anti-India slogans. "They started saying that 'we'll not do work in such a film'," he said. "So after every take, I [also] started saying 'Bharat Mata ki jai'," he added.

122.title: Coach Ponting addresses squad ahead of IPL 2022, DC share video
122.article_body: DC have shared a video in which head coach Ricky Ponting can be seen addressing the squad for the first time ahead of the IPL season. "This tournament for me is not just about the players and the coaches...What we try and create...is a family environment," said Ponting. DC will play their first match against MI on March 27.

123.title: Who holds the record for playing the most deliveries in a Test match?
123.article_body: Late England batter Walter Reginald Hammond holds the record for playing the most deliveries in a Test. He faced a total of 977 deliveries to set the record in a Test against Australia in 1929. He is followed by Herbert Sutcliffe (871 deliveries), Leonard Hutton (847), Glenn Turner (759), Robert Simpson (749), Geoffrey Boycott (725) and Mark Taylor (723).

124.title: Madhuri, Jackie recreate song 'Sun Beliya' from film 100 Days, share video
124.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit recreated her song 'Sun Beliya' from 1991 film '100 Days' along with actor Jackie Shroff. Taking to Instagram, Madhuri shared a reel, dancing with Jackie Shroff and captioned it, "Had a great time creating a reel with this peppy number from '100 Days' with @apnabhidu. Totally lit up the set." The duo had previously worked in 'Khalnayak'.

125.title: 6 arrested in murder of Puri Jagannath temple servitor
125.article_body: The Odisha police arrested six persons in connection with the murder of a servitor of the Puri Jagannath temple. The victim, Krushna Chandra Pratihari, was shot in the head and chest by two persons outside a gym last week. "As per our preliminary investigation, it seems to be a revenge killing. We are also investigating a land deal," said police.

126.title: LIC files updated IPO prospectus with Q3 results: Reports
126.article_body: LIC has filed an updated draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with market regulator SEBI for its upcoming IPO, PTI reported. The updated DRHP includes LIC's Q3 FY22 financials. LIC had earlier filed its draft papers with SEBI in February. According to reports, the LIC IPO, earlier scheduled for March, was postponed to mid-May due to rising market volatility.

127.title: Jhunjhunwala purchased 12 apartments for ₹371 crore to build his new home: Report
127.article_body: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala bought 12 apartments in Ridgeway Apartments Malabar Hill to build his new multi-storey home currently being built in Mumbai, Moneycontrol reported. He paid ₹176 crore in 2013 for the first six apartments and ₹195 crore in 2017 for the next six. Jhunjhunwala's new home will spread across 70,000 square feet and will also have a banquet hall.

128.title: UN chief warns against 'addiction to fossil fuels' amid Russia crisis
128.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres has warned that countries finding alternatives to fossil fuel supplies from Russia, which is facing sanctions, could hinder climate goals. "Countries could become so consumed by the immediate fossil fuel supply gap that they neglect or knee-cap policies to cut fossil fuel use," said Guterres. "Addiction to fossil fuels is mutually assured destruction," he added.

129.title: Was a big deal for me to get picked by CSK in IPL mega auction: Dube
129.article_body: Shivam Dube said it was big deal for him to get picked by Chennai Super Kings in the IPL 2022 mega auction. Dube revealed he had a word with MS Dhoni recently where the latter asked Dube to do a few things. "I told him I'll...do justice. When Mahi bhai asks you to do something, consider it done," he added.

130.title: CSK have two options: Irfan Pathan on Faf du Plessis' replacement
130.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said Devon Conway or Robin Uthappa could fill in Faf Du Plessis' spot in Chennai Super Kings' batting order in IPL 2022. "They've two options...Wankhede and CCI are good pitches, the ones you play in overseas, Conway looks very comfortable in that," Pathan said. "If Conway doesn't play...Uthappa opens...you'll get...to play Maheesh Theekshana," he added.

131.title: Winning and losing part of game, he gave his best: Lakshya Sen's mother
131.article_body: Indian badminton player Lakshya Sen's mother Nirmala Sen praised her son's performance after he clinched silver medal at All England Open Badminton Championships 2022 on Sunday. "Winning and losing are part of the game. Lakshya gave his best and becoming runner-up is a big achievement considering his age (20)," said Nirmala. "I'm confident of Lakshya making a comeback," she added.

132.title: Gurugram Police arrest 3 people for cheating e-commerce firm
132.article_body: Gurugram Police on Sunday said that they have arrested three people, including a delivery partner, for cheating an e-commerce company. The accused would order laptops and place orders to return them alleging that they were defective, they added. However, they would remove the laptops and fill the box with A4 sheets before sending them back, the police further said.

133.title: We stopped feeling normal: KL Rahul on bio-bubbles
133.article_body: Talking about bio-bubbles during cricket tours amid the pandemic, KL Rahul said, "I was quite okay initially, but I think the last series and the West Indies series at home really got to me." He added, "You need your family, your friends to just feel normal. We stopped feeling normal. We had to sleep, wake-up, go to the ground."

134.title: Steve Smith gets angry due to buggy camera, video goes viral
134.article_body: Australia vice-captain Steve Smith got angry after being distracted by a buggy camera while batting in the first innings of the third Test against Pakistan in Lahore. A video has gone viral showing Smith gesturing towards the camera at the midwicket boundary. "One thing is for sure, Smith has the best peripheral vision," the commentator said.

135.title: Indian origin woman killed in student flat in London, Tunisian national arrested
135.article_body: Scotland Yard have arrested a 22-year-old Tunisian national after a 19-year-old Indian origin British woman was found allegedly murdered in her student accommodation in London. The victim Sabita Thanwani had been in a relationship with the accused Maher Maaroufe, said the Metropolitan Police. Thanwani was found with serious injuries to the neck and was pronounced dead at the scene.

136.title: It's better not to say anything about Dhoni, he's one-man army: Saba Karim
136.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has said it's better not to speculate whether IPL 2022 will be MS Dhoni's last or not. "How many matches will he play, how many more years will he play, it's very difficult to say...because he's a player who's a one-man army," he stated. "We will have to wait this season at least," Karim added.

137.title: IPL is the biggest domestic tournament in the world: Sam Billings
137.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders' Sam Billings has said that IPL is the biggest domestic tournament in the world. "It's my sixth year and absolutely love playing over here in India...It's an honour to play here," Billings added. KKR bought the wicketkeeper-batsman for ₹2 crore in the IPL 2022 mega auction. The 30-year-old has previously played for CSK and DC.

138.title: Ola Electric invests in Israeli battery tech firm StoreDot
138.article_body: Ola Electric has invested in Israeli battery technology firm StoreDot, a pioneer in batteries with extreme fast charging (XFC) technology, Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said. The investment will give Ola Electric access to the XFC technology that charges batteries from 0 to 100% in five minutes. Ola will also have exclusive rights to manufacture batteries with XFC technology in India.

139.title: How was Cyclone Asani named and what does it mean?
139.article_body: Expected to form over Andaman and Nicobar Islands on Monday evening, Cyclone Asani is the year's first cyclone and the first to form in the month of March. Named by Sri Lanka, it means 'wrath' in Sinhala, one of their official languages. As per a list by IMD in 2020, it was Sri Lanka's turn to pick a name.

140.title: Jhunjhunwala's multi-storey mansion to have living room larger than 3BHK: Report
140.article_body: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's 70,000 sq ft multi-storey Mumbai residence will have living and dining rooms larger than the size of 3BHK apartments in luxury projects, Moneycontrol reported. "His master bedroom of 731 square feet is 20% bigger than the average 2BHK," it added. The 4th floor will have a banquet hall and the 10th floor will have four guest bedrooms.

141.title: Looking forward to playing alongside Rashid Khan in IPL 2022: Tewatia
141.article_body: Rahul Tewatia, who will be playing for Gujarat Titans in the IPL 2022, said that he's looking forward to sharing the dressing room and playing alongside Afghanistan's Rashid Khan. "Rashid is a mystery bowler so will try to add a little mystery in my bowling," Tewatia added. The all-rounder was bought by Gujarat for ₹9 crore in the mega auction.

142.title: NZ Women assistant coach Oram leaves Women's World Cup midway
142.article_body: New Zealand Women assistant coach Jacob Oram left the squad in the middle of the ongoing ICC Women's World Cup on Monday. The former cricketer had to leave after learning that his family members have tested COVID-19 positive. The White Ferns have won just two out of their six games and are currently placed sixth on the points table.

143.title: Govt considering measures to reduce medical fees in state: K'taka CM
143.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the government is considering measures to reduce fees for medical course in the state. He added that the NMC is looking into it, following the Ukraine crisis to facilitate more students to study here. He added, the Centre is considering alternative measures for medical students, who have returned from Ukraine, before completing their course.

144.title: I'm staying as 'ghar jamai' at her house: Ankita Lokhande's husband Vicky Jain
144.article_body: Television actress Ankita Lokhande's husband Vicky Jain said he is living at Ankita's house as 'ghar jamai'. "We had bought a flat and repairing work, renovation and everything couldn't be completed on time because of pandemic. It got delayed...and is still pending so we couldn't shift to new house...Whenever I visit Mumbai I've been staying at Ankita's house, he added.

145.title: Proud: Karan as PM Modi inspects antiquities repatriated to India from Australia
145.article_body: Ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's virtual summit with his Australian counterpart Scott Morrison on Monday, Australia handed over around 29 antiquities to India. Taking to Twitter,  Filmmaker Karan Johar retweeted a video of PM Modi examining the antiquities and wrote, "News that'll fill every Indian's heart with utmost pride @narendramodi. 29 antiquities repatriated to India from Australia."

146.title: No re-exams for students who were absent due to hijab protest in K'taka
146.article_body: The Karnataka government said that no re-examinations will be held for students who missed the second PUC exams 2022 while participating in hijab protests. Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said providing the students a second opportunity was "impossible". "We won't create a precedent by holding re-exams for absentees. They can appear for supplementary exams like everyone else," he added.

147.title: N Biren Singh takes oath as Manipur CM; 5 MLAs sworn in as Cabinet ministers
147.article_body: N Biren Singh on Monday took oath as the Chief Minister of Manipur, for the second term. Singh was administered the oath of office by Manipur Governor La Ganesan at Raj Bhavan in Imphal. Five MLAs, including Nemcha Kipgen, Yumnam Khemchand Singh, Thongam Biswajit Singh, Awangbou Newmai and Govindas Konthoujam, were also sworn in as Cabinet ministers of the state.

148.title: Numbers are part of journey not destination: Ashwin on 442 Test wickets
148.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin, who recently became India's second highest wicket-taker in Tests after he surpassed Kapil Dev's tally of 434 wickets, said it's humbling to see what he's been able to do in terms of numbers. The off-spinner added that numbers are a part of journey rather than the destination. Ashwin has taken 442 wickets from 86 Tests so far.

149.title: No proposal from RBI on crypto trading mechanism yet: Govt
149.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Monday said the RBI has not yet proposed any mechanism for the trading of crypto assets. He said the cryptocurrency sector's legal framework "may be finalised only after all aspects are carefully examined". Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had earlier proposed a 30% tax on income earned from crypto transactions in Budget 2022.

150.title: BJP announces 6 more names, completes list for all 36 UP MLC seats
150.article_body: After announcing candidates on 30 seats, BJP has now announced candidates on six more seats for the upcoming UP Legislative Council elections in which 36 MLC seats will be contested. The BJP's list comprises of several defectors including those from BSP, SP and Congress. Currently, BJP has 35 MLCs while SP has 17 MLCs in the 100-member UP Legislative Council.

151.title: Mandeep Singh's last-minute goal helps India beat Argentina 4-3
151.article_body: Striker Mandeep Singh's last-minute goal helped India beat Argentina by 4-3 in the FIH Pro League match in Bhubaneswar on Sunday. Argentina were trailing 0-2 at half-time but the 2016 Olympic champion managed to equalise in the final quarter until Mandeep scored with just 26 seconds remaining. Defender Varun Kumar was named the 'Player of the Match' for his performance.

152.title: B'luru zoo holds awareness session to mark World Sparrow Day
152.article_body: Bengaluru Bannerghatta Biological Park tweeted on Sunday that it held an awareness session for visitors to mark World Sparrow Day and Global Recycling Day. The awareness session was about the ecological importance of sparrows and the threats and ways to conserve them by recycling items and creating nest boxes, feeders and water troughs, the zoo said.

153.title: Will try to better my 2nd inning of politics: Supriyo on Bengal by-polls
153.article_body: Ahead of West Bengal Assembly by-elections, Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo said on Monday that he'll try to better his "second inning of politics". Supriyo, who is TMC's candidate from the Ballygunge seat, filed his nomination for the polls today. Supriyo had resigned as Union Minister and BJP's MP from Asansol in 2021 citing "politics of hatred" as reason.

154.title: Delhi's Pragati Maidan corridor to be opened in a month: Deputy CM
154.article_body: The Pragati Maidan road corridor and tunnel project is almost complete and will open in a month, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Monday. After reviewing the project's progress, Sisodia tweeted, "This corridor will soon ease traffic in and around Ring Road and India Gate." Under the project, Delhi's PWD is constructing a 1.2-km-long tunnel and six underpasses.

155.title: Temple idol in Noida vandalised, police launch probe
155.article_body: The police said that an idol in a temple in Noida's Behlolpur village was found vandalised on Monday morning. "A police team along with forensic experts and a dog squad reached the site to look into the matter immediately," a senior police officer said. "Some blood samples were...found there which prima facie look like human blood," the officer added.

156.title: Kraigg Brathwaite breaks record for playing most deliveries in a Test by a West Indian
156.article_body: West Indies captain Kraigg Brathwaite has broken the record for playing most deliveries in a Test match by a West Indian. The 29-year-old played a total of 673 deliveries in the second Test against England in Barbados. He surpassed the previous record of 582 deliveries set by Brian Lara against England in 2004.

157.title: Hyd Police to organise job fair on Mar 26; 30 companies to participate
157.article_body: Hyderabad Police will organise a 'Mega Job Mela' on March 26, the official Twitter handle of Banjara Hills SHO tweeted on Saturday. The job fair will be held from 9:30 am onwards at the Sri Kotla Vijaya Bhaskar Reddy Stadium. As many as 30 companies, including ICICI Bank, will participate in the event to recruit over 3,000 people, police added.

158.title: Told govt 'don't repeal farm laws, it'd be unfair to majority': SC panel member
158.article_body: Anil Ghanwat, who was part of the SC-appointed panel examining the farm laws, has said the committee advised the government against repealing the laws. The repeal would be unfair to the 'silent' (not part of protest) majority of farmers who support the laws, the panel told the government according to Ghanwat. Most farmers' organisations consulted, supported the laws, he revealed.

159.title: China to send additional aid worth nearly ₹12 crore to Ukraine
159.article_body: Chinese Red Cross will offer an additional humanitarian aid worth 10 million yuan (nearly ₹12 crore) to Ukraine amid its conflict with Russia, Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said on Monday. This takes aid pledged by China to Ukraine to 15 million yuan (nearly ₹18 crore). Earlier, UN said that 902 civilians have been killed in Ukraine since February 24.

160.title: His leg-side play, flicks are wonderful: Sangakkara on RR's Padikkal
160.article_body: Asked about any aspect of game he'd like to have from Devdutt Padikkal, RR Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said the batter's leg-side play and flicks are wonderful. "He's such an exciting player, so accomplished. I just want him to know how valuable he is for...team" he added. Padikkal was bought by RR for ₹7.75 crore in mega auction 2022.

161.title: He is Aatmanirbhar: Anand Mahindra on 19-year-old's midnight run in Noida
161.article_body: Sharing the viral video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said, "He is Aatmanirbhar!" While he refused a lift offered by filmmaker Vinod Kapri, Mahindra wrote, "This is indeed inspiring. But you know what my Monday Motivation is? The fact that he is so independent and refuses the offer of a ride."

162.title: I don't belong here, I don't belong there: Afghanistan's ex-FM driving Uber in US
162.article_body: Khalid Payenda, who resigned as Afghanistan's Finance Minister as the Taliban took over the country in August 2021, is now working as an Uber driver in the US, The Washington Post reported. "Right now, I don't have any place. I don't belong here and I don't belong there," Payenda said. He also works as an adjunct professor at Georgetown University.

163.title: Renault resumes production at Moscow plant
163.article_body: French automobile manufacturer Renault has resumed production at its plant in Moscow. Renault suspended operations at its car assembly plant in Moscow in late February due to logistics bottlenecks that caused component shortages. According to ratings agency Fitch, Renault generated 10% of its revenue and around 12% of its operating profit margin in the country in 2021.

164.title: We're helpless: Medical student back from China on training recognition
164.article_body: Murshid Aleen, an Indian student studying MBBS in a Chinese university, who came back in 2020 spoke about physical training in India. "It's been two years since we have been attending online classes...Most of us are doing are practicals at various government and private hospitals in Kerala, but is not recognised...we are helpless right now," Aleen said.

165.title: 61 of 73 farmers' bodies consulted fully supported farm laws: SC panel report
165.article_body: A member of the SC-appointed panel on the farm laws has said that 61 of 73 farmers' organisations (representing over 3.83 crore farmers) interviewed, fully supported the repealed laws. Making details of the panel's report public, Anil Ghanwat said protesting farmers didn't engage with the panel. MSP played no role in the lives of farmers who were consulted, he added.

166.title: Nadda arrives in Imphal ahead of N Biren Singh's oath taking ceremony
166.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda arrived in Imphal on Monday, ahead of the swearing-in ceremony of Manipur CM- designate N Biren Singh. He is going to be the CM of Manipur for the second time, the BJP announced on Sunday. Singh was unanimously elected as the CM in the Manipur BJP legislature party meeting in Imphal.

167.title: Startups get up to 10 years for converting debt investment into equity
167.article_body: The government has extended the timeline for startups to convert debt investment made in the company into equity shares to 10 years, according to a press note by DPIIT. Startups previously had up to 5 years to convert their debt investment into equity effective from the day of issuance of convertible note.

168.title: 3 CRPF personnel injured as Maoists attack security camp in Chhattisgarh
168.article_body: Three Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel sustained injuries after Maoists allegedly opened fire at a security camp in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district using country-made weapons, police said. The injured personnel are stable and have been airlifted to Raipur for better treatment, Bastar Inspector General of Police said. The Maoists also allegedly hurled locally-made grenades, police added.

169.title: Retired General offers to help 19-yr-old get into Army after his viral running video
169.article_body: Reacting to the video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight, a Retired Army General offered his help. In reference to his wish to join the Army, Lt General Satish Dua tweeted, "To help him pass the recruitment tests on his merit, I've interacted with Colonel of Kumaon Regiment...He's doing the needful to train the boy for recruitment."

170.title: Bombay HC rejects plea to stay OTT release of Ranveer Singh's '83'
170.article_body: The Bombay High Court has rejected Mad Man Film Ventures' plea against the makers of Ranveer Singh-starrer '83' to stay its release on OTT platforms. The plea had alleged copyright infringement, adding that Mad Man had not granted its consent to the platforms to broadcast the film. The court however upheld the exploitation rights of Reliance Entertainment Studios Pvt Ltd.

171.title: Kissed my friend while I was married to Karan; got attracted to him: Nisha
171.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant, Nisha Rawal revealed on the show that she had kissed another man while she was married to her ex-husband Karan Mehra. Nisha said, "I met an old friend...I confided in him about...lot of things apart from the abusive past." "I...got attracted to him...I kissed that person. [But] I confessed [to Karan] that day itself," she added.

172.title: Australia name Daniel Vettori as spin consultant for ODIs, T20I vs Pak
172.article_body: Former New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori has been appointed as Australia's spin consultant for the white-ball leg of their ongoing series against Pakistan. Australia are currently playing their third and final Test against Pakistan in Lahore, which will be followed by a three-match ODI series, beginning on March 29. Australia will also play a lone T20I on April 5.

173.title: Examining educational concerns of evacuated students from Ukraine: Centre to SC
173.article_body: The Central government on Monday told the Supreme Court that the Government of India has evacuated 22,500 students from Ukraine and it is also looking into their educational concerns. "A mammoth task has been completed," the Attorney General of India, KK Venugopal, told the apex court. The apex court then closed the two petitions pending before it on the issue.

174.title: US to declare Rohingya repression in Myanmar a 'genocide': Officials
174.article_body: The US is set to declare the violence committed on the Rohingya Muslims by the Myanmar military a 'genocide' on Monday, officials have said. This comes as Myanmar is already facing accusations of genocide at the International Court of Justice (ICJ).
