Myanmar military began a crackdown on Rohingya community in 2017, reportedly forcing over 7,00,000 people to flee the country.

175.title: Have met kids who saw their parents being murdered: Pallavi on 'The Kashmir..'
175.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi said that she and husband Vivek Agnihotri researched for 'The Kashmir Files' for more than four years. "We went to...USA, UK, Germany, Singapore, Jammu and Kashmir, Pune, Thailand, Delhi...wherever we could find first family of the victim...whose father was murdered, whose mother was raped, children who saw their parents being murdered...We have met those people," she added.

176.title: Siddhant and I are good friends, I call us Tom and Jerry: Ananya
176.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday in an interview has revealed that she is good friends with actor and 'Gehraiyaan' co-star Siddhant Chaturvedi. "I call us Tom and Jerry because we fight a lot," the actress added. In a 2020 interview, Siddhant had responded to Ananya talking about the struggles she faced in Bollywood saying, "Their struggle begins where our dreams come true."

177.title: What's the case involving 'Child Q', the 15-yr-old Black girl strip-searched in London?
177.article_body: A 15-year-old Black girl was strip-searched while she was menstruating at her school in London by police officers after she was wrongly suspected of carrying drugs. The incident which took place in 2020 has come to light this month. Thousands of people took part in protests in London in support of the girl, who is now known as 'Child Q'.

178.title: Is it against my job to be educated: Nakuul on article on actors' qualifications
178.article_body: Actor Nakuul Mehta on Monday shared an article titled 'Educational qualifications of...actors will leave you stunned'. He wrote, "Why must it leave you stunned? Does it go against my job to be educated?" Actress Nikita Dutta replied to his tweet writing, "Educated no. But well-read yes," while journalist Surbhi Dutta wrote, "It shows...society's mindset and how it looks at showbiz."

179.title: Saffron flag may become national flag if Hindus unite: RSS leader
179.article_body: RSS leader Kalladka Prabhakar Bhat said if Hindus unite, the "Bhagwa Dwaj" (saffron flag) may become the national flag. "It can and should happen if Hindu Samaj comes together," Bhat said. "If a majority of people vote in Parliament and Rajya Sabha in favour of changing the National Flag, then the flag can be changed," Bhat stated.

180.title: 3,677 traffic e-challans issued in GB Nagar on Sunday: Police
180.article_body: Traffic police in Gautam Buddha Nagar on Sunday issued 3,677 e-challans to vehicle owners for various violations, officials said. This was part of a special campaign carried out by the police in the district. "During the campaign, police officials were deployed at all intersections and other important locations where they checked the offenders," a police spokesperson said.

181.title: Zelenskyy praises Mila Kunis & Ashton Kutcher after they raise $35 mn for Ukraine
181.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday thanked Hollywood couple Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis, who have been able to collect over $35 million for Ukraine through their fundraiser. Zelenskyy shared a picture of the three of them on a video call and wrote, "They inspire the world." Mila Kunis was born in Chernivtsi in Ukraine.

182.title: 3 siblings killed, 1 injured as dilapidated house collapses in Gujarat
182.article_body: Three siblings died and their 18-year-old sister sustained injuries when their house collapsed in Gujarat's Bharuch on Monday, police said. The single-storey dilapidated house caved in while the children's parents were away at work. The four children were pulled out from under the rubble by fire brigade personnel and taken to a hospital, where three of them were pronounced dead.

183.title: PSG lose 0-3, suffer their worst defeat against Monaco in 23 years
183.article_body: Ligue 1 leaders Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) were beaten 0-3 by Monaco, with forward Wissam Ben Yedder scoring two goals. This was Monaco's biggest league win against PSG since 1999, according to Ligue 1 statistics. Notably, PSG took the field on Sunday without Lionel Messi and Sergio Ramos. PSG are placed top of the Ligue 1 table with nine matches remaining.

184.title: Leopard sighted at Mercedes-Benz India campus in Pune, employees evacuated
184.article_body: A leopard was sighted on the campus of Mercedes-Benz India in Pune on Monday, following which, employees were evacuated to a safe spot. The leopard was rescued by forest department officials with the help of local police. Reports said that the leopard will soon be taken to a transit facility in Junnar.

185.title: Musk's Starlink helping Ukrainian drone unit destroy Russian tanks at night
185.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Starlink system is helping a Ukrainian drone unit destroy Russian tanks and command trucks. "If we use a drone with thermal vision at night, the drone must connect through Starlink to the artillery guy and create target acquisition," the unit's leader told The Times. Starlink ensures the teams can work even during internet or power outages.

186.title: Video shows fire in Chinese mountains where flight with 133 passengers crashed
186.article_body: A video has shown fire breaking out in the mountains in China where a China Eastern Airlines flight carrying 133 passengers crashed on Monday. Flight MU5735 got lost during its route from Kunming to Guangzhou, reported China's state-affiliated ShanghaiEye. The jet involved in the accident was a Boeing 737 aircraft and the number of casualties wasn't immediately known, Reuters reported.

187.title: 'The Kashmir..' reveals inhuman horror of religious bigotry: UP CM
187.article_body: Uttar Pradesh caretaker Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath took to Twitter to share a picture with the team of 'The Kashmir Files'. "The film The Kashmir Files boldly reveals the inhuman horror of religious bigotry and terrorism. Undoubtedly, this film will work to make society and country aware. Congratulations to entire team for producing such a thought-provoking film," the tweet read.

188.title: Maha to probe alleged funds misuse under former BJP govt's scheme
188.article_body: Maharashtra Women and Child Development Minister Yashomati Thakur said on Monday that the state government will be setting up a committee to probe the alleged misappropriation of state funds under the 'Prajwala' scheme of the previous BJP government. Thakur said this in the state Legislative Council following a calling to attention notice by Shiv Sena leader Manisha Kayande.

189.title: 2 Pak lawmakers booked for protesting against dissident party member
189.article_body: Two provincial lawmakers of Pakistan PM Imran Khan-led PTI have been booked for protesting outside the residence of the party's dissident national assembly member Ramesh Kumar Vankwani in Karachi. An FIR was registered against Shah Nawaz Jadoon, Saeed Ullah Afridi and several other party members. This comes days ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Khan.

190.title: It was a tough call: Rahul on leaving PBKS after IPL 2021
190.article_body: LSG's newly-appointed captain KL Rahul has opened on leaving PBKS after four years, stating that it was a tough call but he wanted to see if there's a "new journey" for him. "Wanted to see what's in store for me...I've been attached to Punjab for a long time...[but] I wanted to see if I can do something else," Rahul explained.

191.title: I work at McD in Noida, run 10 km every night to join Army: 19-yr-old in viral video
191.article_body: Pradeep Mehra, the 19-year-old youth whose video of running in the midnight in Noida went viral after being shared by filmmaker Vinod Kapri, said that he does so as he wants to "join the Army". Mehra, who works at Noida Sector-16's McDonald's, runs from his work to Barola every night, covering 10 kilometres. He rejected Kapri's offer for a lift.

192.title: BJP MP gives Zero Hour notice in Rajya Sabha demanding Uniform Civil Code
192.article_body: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav on Monday submitted a Zero Hour notice in Rajya Sabha demanding the implementation of Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the country. Notably, the party had promised to bring UCC in Uttarakhand ahead of the assembly elections. Months ago, the Centre had told Delhi High Court that there is no immediate plan to implement UCC.

193.title: Video shows Tesla jumping 50 ft in air before crashing during a stunt in US
193.article_body: The Los Angeles police shared a video of a Tesla car speeding and flying 50 ft in the air before it crashed into parked cars and trash cans. It was reportedly driven by a rental driver, who was performing a stunt at a meet-up of Tesla users. The police have announced a reward of $1,000 for information about the driver.

194.title: Words 'f***ing' & 'b**ch' removed from Telugu version of RRR: Reports
194.article_body: The pan-India film 'RRR', starring actors Ram Charan and Jr NTR, reportedly had to undergo several cuts, days ahead of its release. According to reports, the Telugu version of 'RRR' has been granted a U/A certificate with three audio cuts. The abusive words like 'f***ing* and 'b**ch' were asked to be removed by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC).

195.title: Challenges like pandemic, war make it important for India to be self-reliant: PM
195.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said challenges faced by the world like the Russia-Ukraine war and the COVID-19 pandemic make it all the more important for India to become self-reliant. "In today's world, it is difficult to estimate when and what will happen and how it will affect us," PM Modi added. He also highlighted the importance of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat'.

196.title: Roped in Alia as 'Sita' because we wanted a girl with inner strength: Rajamouli
196.article_body: Speaking about Alia's role as 'Sita' in RRR, filmmaker SS Rajamouli said it's not a full-fledged character but an important cameo. "We wanted a soft, fragile-looking girl but who also has enough inner strength...This is why I wanted Alia to do this role," he added. "The length of character [is] less but the importance of the character is...high," he said.

197.title: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee appears before ED in Delhi in coal scam case
197.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee was on Monday questioned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) at its Delhi office in connection with the coal scam case. Banerjee reached the central probe agency's office at around 11 am today. He was earlier questioned in this case in September. The ED has also summoned his wife, Rujira.

198.title: Plane carrying 133 passengers crashes in China, casualties unknown: Reports
198.article_body: A China Eastern Airlines aircraft carrying 133 passengers from Kunming to Guangzhou crashed in Guangxi on Monday, AFP and Reuters reported. The reports quoting Chinese media said that the number of casualties is unknown. Reuters reported that the plane, a Boeing 737 aircraft, had an "accident" in the region of Guangxi and caused a fire in the mountains.

199.title: 37 die after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar since Holi
199.article_body: About 37 people have died after allegedly consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's Bhagalpur, Banka and Madhepura since Holi, according to an official of state police. However, police claimed that they're "mysterious deaths" and probe is ongoing to determine the actual cause. Two persons died due to an ailment and heart attack respectively, as per their families, Bhagalpur District Magistrate said.

200.title: B'desh pacer Taskin Ahmed likely to join LSG as Mark Wood's replacement
200.article_body: LSG are likely to sign Bangladesh pacer Taskin Ahmed as Mark Wood's replacement for the upcoming IPL season. Wood, who was bought by LSG for ₹7.5 crore in the auction, was ruled out of the tournament after suffering an injury on his right elbow during the ongoing Test series between England and WI. Taskin has 23 wickets in 33 T20Is.

201.title: CBI arrests intelligence officer for taking ₹60 lakh bribe in Ghaziabad
201.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation has arrested a senior intelligence officer, Mohit Dhankar, for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹60 lakh. The incident came to light when a businessman complained to the CBI about an alleged demand of ₹1 crore by the officer in return for a favour to the businessman's father who has a case against him.

202.title: Couple from Mumbai booked for abetting their 35-yr-old maid's suicide
202.article_body: A couple from Mumbai's Bandra was booked for allegedly abetting the suicide of a 35-year-old woman, who was working as a maid at their home. The woman, who was debt-ridden, was promised a salary of ₹11,000 initially and ₹15,000 after she learned cooking. The woman reportedly became depressed after the accused, dissatisfied with her work, asked her to stop working.

203.title: Which countries have opened criminal cases against Russia over war crimes in Ukraine?
203.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova has announced that six countries have already opened criminal cases in relation to Russian war crimes in Ukraine. They are Estonia, Lithuania, Germany, Poland, Slovakia and Sweden. "We'll work closely with them to facilitate exchange of information and evidence," she added. Russia started invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

204.title: Shocked by arrest, alleged torture of UP journalist: Editors Guild
204.article_body: Editors Guild of India (EGI) on Monday said that it's "shocked" by the manner in which a journalist based in Uttar Pradesh's Agra was arrested and allegedly tortured for reporting apparent malpractices in Assembly elections. It demanded Gaurav Bansal's immediate release and an independent court-monitored inquiry. Bansal's lawyer claimed that he was "tortured and humiliated" by police, EGI added.

205.title: Kaaranvir breaks down on 'Lock Upp' as he meets wife, daughters; video surfaces
205.article_body: Actor Kaaranvir Bohra, who is currently a contestant on the reality show 'Lock Upp', broke down when his wife Teejay Sidhu and daughters Bella, Vienna and Gia visited him on the show. In the video that was posted on his Instagram page, he can be seen crying while hugging his daughters. His youngest daughter can also be seen running around.

206.title: Now I'll sue all in UK, then see the fun: Lalit Modi on Bombay HC ruling in favour of him
206.article_body: After the Bombay High Court declared that the ₹425 crore Facilitation Fee in IPL broadcast rights case was legal and all parties, including BCCI, were aware of it, ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi said, "Today I feel vindicated as justice is delivered." "Now I will sue all in UK, then see the fun," he told Cricbuzz.

207.title: AAP MLA Kultar Sandhwan unanimously elected Punjab Assembly Speaker
207.article_body: Two-time Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Kultar Singh Sandhwan was unanimously elected as the Speaker of the 16th Punjab Legislative Assembly in Chandigarh on Monday. Mann, who had proposed Sandhwan's name in the House, congratulated him and said, "I hope you will give equal opportunity to everyone." Mann also urged the 46-year-old Speaker to allow live proceedings of the House.

208.title: LS Speaker Om Birla flagged off 'Prasadam Rath' from his residence in Delhi
208.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla flagged off the 'Prasadam Rath' from his residence in Delhi on Monday. "This free food scheme for the poor, underprivileged has been kickstarted across seven hospitals," Birla said. Through this initiative, the attendants of patients will get free food in the hospitals. "It will soon be expanded further in the national capital," Birla added.

209.title: Texas wildfires destroy 86 homes; sheriff’s deputy killed helping people
209.article_body: As many as 86 homes were reportedly destroyed as wildfires continued to rage in Texas. The fires which started on Wednesday or Thursday are said to have burned down 85% of the town of Carbon. A sheriff's deputy was killed as he tried to help people escape. "Everywhere you turn, it looks like a bomb went off," said an eyewitness.

210.title: I've always tried to play strong female protagonist in films: Rani
210.article_body: Actress Rani Mukerji said she has never accepted to be typecast or fit in a mould. "I've always tried to be part of meaningful films with a very strong female protagonist at the centre of the story," she added. Rani further said that she has always wanted to be a part of good films with important stories about Indian women.

211.title: Irrespective of being RR captain, Samson is among best T20 players: Sangakkara
211.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket and head coach Kumar Sangakkara has praised their captain Sanju Samson, stating that the 27-year-old has natural leadership qualities. "Irrespective of being RR captain, he's one of the best T20 players...He's a captain who is willing to admit that he doesn't know everything as yet and he is going to grow into it," Sangakkara added.

212.title: Director Girish Malik's son died by suicide after he was asked to stop drinking: Police
212.article_body: Director Girish Malik's 18-year-old son Mannan had died by suicide by jumping from the fifth floor of an apartment building in Mumbai on Friday, police have said. Mannan took the step at the Oberoi Springs building in Andheri after his father had allegedly asked him to stop drinking and behave well with his mother, added the police.

213.title: India evacuated 22,500 students, Indian nationals from Ukraine: Centre to SC
213.article_body: The Central Government has told the Supreme Court of India that 22,500 students and Indian nationals have been evacuated from Ukraine amid the ongoing crisis and that "a mammoth task has been completed". Centre also said students who returned from Ukraine have emphasised to government on issue of continuation of their studies here and that government is looking into issue.

214.title: Till Deepak Chahar comes into playing XI, CSK need to rely on Hangargekar: Irfan
214.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said CSK need to rely on uncapped pacer Rajvardhan Hangargekar till Deepak Chahar becomes available for playing in the upcoming IPL season. "You know Hangargekar is a fantastic young talent...CSK have MS Dhoni...behind the stumps and that makes things a lot easier...So, I feel they nearly found some sort of replacement," Irfan added.

215.title: Actress-YouTuber Dolly D Cruze passes away aged 26 in road accident
215.article_body: Actress-YouTuber Dolly D Cruze died aged 26 in a road accident in Hyderabad. Dolly D Cruze, also known as Gayathri, met with an accident while returning home from a Holi party. She was travelling with a friend, who lost control of the vehicle and rammed into a divider. Dolly had recently worked in Telugu web series 'Madam Sir Madam Anthe'.

216.title: RGV praises The Kashmir Files, says 'I hate it; it destroyed whatever I learnt'
216.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma reviewed the film 'The Kashmir Files'. Taking to Twitter, Varma shared a video titled 'I hate Kashmir Files'. In the video, he praised the film and said, "'The Kashmir Files' released and broke every rule in the book." "I hate 'The Kashmir Files' because it destroyed whatever I learnt, whatever I thought was right," he added.

217.title: NDRF teams deployed in Andaman & Nicobar ahead of Cyclone Asani
217.article_body: As Cyclone Asani is likely to intensify into a deep depression in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel have been deployed at different locations. They have been provided with all the necessary equipment to carry out search and rescue operations. Indian Army, IAF and Indian Coast Guard have put their teams on stand by.

218.title: 4 killed, 1 missing as fishing boat sinks off New Zealand coast
218.article_body: A fishing boat sank off the New Zealand coast on Sunday killing four people. The rescue teams are looking for one person who went missing, while five others were moved to safety by a helicopter. The five were taken to a hospital and were released later. The boat had sent out a distress signal, following which the search operation began.

219.title: AAP nominates Harbhajan Singh, Raghav Chadha, IIT prof for RS from Punjab
219.article_body: Former cricketer Harbhajan Singh, IIT professor Sandeep Pathak, Delhi MLA Raghav Chadha and Lovely Professional University (LPU) Chancellor Ashok Mittal and industrialist Sanjeev Arora are the Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) nominees for Rajya Sabha, party officials confirmed. The Rajya Sabha elections will be held on March 31. The party had won 92 of Punjab's 117 seats in the Assembly elections.

220.title: Will punish culprits: Bangladesh after 200 attack ISKCON temple
220.article_body: Bangladesh government has said in a statement on Monday that "exemplary punishment will be handed out to the guilty regardless of religion" in regard to the attack on an ISKCON temple in Dhaka by a mob of 200 people last week. According to the statement, the incident occurred following a legal dispute over the plot adjacent to the ISKCON temple.

221.title: May all aspirations be fulfilled: PM Narendra Modi on Parsi New Year
221.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday greeted the nation on the occasion of Navroz, which is also known as Parsi New Year. "We mark Navroz with a prayer that the coming year brings with it joy and outstanding health in everyone's lives. May all aspirations be fulfilled and may there be prosperity all around," the PM tweeted.

222.title: Woman tied, tortured by husband & in-laws with hot iron rod in MP's Dewas
222.article_body: A woman was allegedly tied by her husband and tortured by him and her in-laws with a hot iron rod, leaving her severely injured, in Madhya Pradesh's Dewas on March 16, Shailendra Mukati, TI, Barotha, said. "The woman was constantly troubled by her in-laws and her husband since giving birth to a daughter," Mukati added.

223.title: 21-yr-old man critical after girlfriend's stalker stabs him in Gujarat
223.article_body: A 21-year-old man, Jagdish, is reported to be critical after he was stabbed multiple times by another man Mukesh who had been engaged to Jagdish's current girlfriend four years ago. Mukesh was also stalking the woman. The engagement was broken due to Mukesh's drinking habits. "Mukesh and Jagdish have had verbal spats due to issue in the past," Police said.

224.title: Noida reports only one daily Covid-19 case for first time in 2022
224.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar district reported only one Covid-19 case on Sunday, which is the lowest daily figure of this year, according to data from the district health department. The data further revealed that the number of active cases is 76 which is also an all-time low. However, the total cases recorded since the outbreak of the pandemic is 98,472.

225.title: Delhi court asks duo convicted for making fake trust using PM's name to repay victims
225.article_body: A Delhi court has ordered two men, who were convicted for creating a fake charitable trust under PM Narender Modi's name, to compensate the victims they had cheated. The court said the accused must compensate seven persons who had paid ₹25,599 as fees for a basic computer training programme. It also asked them to pay ₹50,000 as cost of prosecution.

226.title: Speeding vehicle kills woman in Gurugram
226.article_body: A woman, Sandhya Hazra (48), was killed allegedly by an unidentified speeding vehicle on the Golf Course Road (GCR) in Gurugram, police said. Hazra had migrated from Berhampore, West Bengal and worked as a maid in Gurugram. "We are trying to find out if there’s footage of any CCTV cameras," said Jang Bahadur, SHO of the Sector-53 Police Station.

227.title: Revamp of Kalyan yard will offer respite to local train passengers: Officials
227.article_body: The Kalyan yard remodelling, for which construction is underway, will help in segregating local and outstation trains, which will eventually bring respite to the commuters, said Railway officials. The remodelling will include the construction of four suburban railway tracks and six outstation train tracks along with others. Kalyan yard remodelling is expected to cost ₹866 crores, an official said.

228.title: Actress Sonam Kapoor announces pregnancy, shares pics
228.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor took to Instagram to announce that she's expecting her first child with husband Anand Ahuja. Sharing pictures, she wrote, "Four hands. To raise you the very best we can. Two hearts. That will beat in unison with yours...every step of the way. One family. Who'll shower you with love and support. We can't wait to welcome you."

229.title: 2 women among 9 held for 50-yr-old man’s murder in Himachal Pradesh
229.article_body: The Mandi police in Himachal Pradesh arrested nine people, including two women, for the murder of a 50-year-old man on March 17. Last Thursday, police received information that a man, who was being chased by some people, had allegedly jumped into the Beas River from Bhiuli Bridge, a police official said. Later, victim's body was retrieved on Friday by divers.

230.title: As global COVID cases show uptick, Maha officials asked to be on alert
230.article_body: As several countries have been reporting a surge in the number of COVID-19 cases across globe, officials in Maharashtra have been asked to be on alert. State Health Minister Rajesh Tope reportedly said that the Central Government is keeping a close watch on the situation and that the state will issue guidelines accordingly.

231.title: Rapper Doja Cat spots fan in distress, stops performance, video surfaces
231.article_body: American rapper Doja Cat stopped her performance midway after she spotted a fan in the crowd in distress. "I love you guys, I really do. We can't have that happening...I'm sorry, I can't keep going if things aren't good," she said, adding, "It's nobody's fault. This stuff happens...There's a lot of people, and people get crushed. It's a lot."

232.title: Canada school board refuses to end mask mandate; parents criticise move
232.article_body: The Hamilton-Wentworth District School Board (HWDSB) in Canada's Ontario is facing criticism from parents for refusing to end the mask mandate. This comes after the provincial administration ordered an end to the mask mandate. "My kids will not be wearing masks,'' said a parent. Notably, 30 other public school boards have decided to go with the government's decision.

233.title: Barcelona are back, it was important to end losing streak: Xavi on Madrid win
233.article_body: After Barcelona registered their first win against Real Madrid in three years, manager Xavi Hernandez said the future looks bright for the club. "I'm happy because we were much better than Real Madrid. We played a spectacular match...nights like this are those you never forget," he added. Barcelona defeated Madrid 4-0 to secure their seventh win in last eight games.

234.title: Female bus conductor manhandled, abused by 2 passengers in Pune
234.article_body: Pune police have said that two passengers who allegedly manhandled and abused a 24-year-old female conductor on a Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) bus have been arrested. The incident occurred following a dispute between the complainant and accused over buying bus tickets, police added. The bus had been travelling from Pune Municipal Corporation to Nigdi, police further said.

235.title: 'Putul Utsav' to be held in 5 cities on World Puppetry Day on March 21
235.article_body: On the occasion of World Puppetry Day on March 21, Delhi's Sangeet Natak Akademi is organising a 'Putul Utsav' (puppet festival) in five cities on Monday. The festival will be celebrated in Delhi, Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, Telangana's Hyderabad, Odisha's Angul and Tripura's Agartala. During the festival, tales of India's struggle for freedom will be retold through the medium of puppets.

236.title: Xi doesn't believe democracy can be sustained in 21st century: Biden
236.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping "does not believe democracy can be sustained in the 21st century". He added that Jinping believed that autocracies will succeed because "democracies don't have time to arrive at consensus" as things move so "rapidly". "I think we're in a genuine struggle between autocracies and democracies," he further said.

237.title: Aamir performs Naatu Naatu song with Alia, Ram Charan & Jr NTR, video surfaces
237.article_body: A video has surfaced online where Aamir Khan attempted 'Naatu Naatu' dance steps with 'RRR' stars Jr NTR and Ram Charan at a recent promotional event for the film. Aamir tried to do the dance steps with Ram Charan, Jr NTR and said, "I can't do it." Alia Bhatt then added from behind, "It's very easy, even I learnt it."

238.title: BJP to fulfil promise of liberating Pakistan occupied Kashmir: Jitendra Singh
238.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh said PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government will fulfil its promise to liberate Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK) just like it fulfilled its promise of abrogating Article 370. "When BJP promises something, it fulfils…Parliament passed a resolution unanimously in 1994, emphasising that Pakistan must vacate parts of J&K under its illegal occupation," Singh added.

239.title: LPG cylinder explodes in Maha; 4 seriously injured, suffer 80% burns
239.article_body: Four people suffered serious injuries after an LPG cylinder exploded in Maharashtra. The injured people suffered 80 per cent burn injuries in the incident, reports said. The explosion took place at a gas agency in Kalwa area of Maharashtra. According to the Thane Municipal Corporation, the injured have been admitted to the hospital after the incident.

240.title: Aryan, Jahnavi & Suhana are not just the future but present of KKR: Juhi
240.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla's daughter Jahnavi participated in this year’s IPL auction ceremony. When asked if Jahnavi and actor Shah Rukh Khan's children, Aryan Khan and Suhana Khan can be tagged as the future of KKR, Juhi said, "Not just...future, they're...present of the team." "It's...funny how there was a time when our kids would be...home and we'd be on...screen," she added.

241.title: Hong Kong to ease COVID-19 curbs, lift flight ban from April
241.article_body: Hong Kong has announced the easing of strict COVID-19 restrictions, including lifting ban on flights from nine countries from April. Chief Executive Carrie Lam said the flight ban would end on April 1 and the hotel quarantine period for those arriving would be reduced from 14 days to seven. The offline classes in schools would resume on April 19.

242.title: What are the different ratings for pitches in Test cricket?
242.article_body: As per ICC, pitches in Test cricket have six specific ratings. Referees can rate pitches as very good, good, average, below average, poor or unfit. A pitch can be rated unfit if it is dangerous. An unfit pitch is given five demerit points, while poor pitches are given three demerit points. A below average pitch is given one demerit point.

243.title: PM Modi inspects 29 antiquities repatriated to India by Australia, video surfaces
243.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday inspected the 29 antiquities which have been repatriated to India by Australia. The antiquities range in six broad categories as per themes - Shiva and his disciples, Worshipping Shakti, Lord Vishnu and his forms, Jain tradition, portraits and decorative objects. These antiquities come from different time periods, with the earliest dating to 9th-10th century CE.

244.title: Delhi-Doha Qatar Airways flight diverted to Karachi after smoke detected in cargo hold
244.article_body: A Delhi-Doha Qatar Airways flight was diverted to Pakistan's Karachi airport after smoke was detected in the cargo hold. "Aircraft landed safely in Karachi where it was met by emergency services and passengers disembarked," Qatar Airways said. The incident is currently under investigation and a relief flight is being arranged to transport passengers onwards to Doha, it added.

245.title: Woman forces daughter to quit studies, work at Navi Mumbai bar; booked
245.article_body: Police have booked a woman and her live-in partner for forcing the woman's 17-year-old daughter to quit her studies and work at a beer bar to support family in Navi Mumbai. Following harassment by her mother and her live-in-partner, the girl ran away from home last month and was tracked down. However, she refused to live with her mother.

246.title: Ex-Ukraine MP's wife tries to leave country with $28 mn, €1.3 mn in suitcases
246.article_body: The wife of former Ukrainian MP Igor Kotvytskyy tried to leave the country with $28 million and €1.3 million in cash stuffed in suitcases. She was trying to escape Ukraine through Zakarpattia province. She was intercepted with the suitcases at the border by the Hungarian border guards and was forced to declare the amount.

247.title: Muslim traders not allowed to set up stalls at festival in K'taka's Shivamogga
247.article_body: The organising committee of Kote Marikamba Jatra, to be held in Karnataka's Shivamogga from Tuesday, reportedly refused to allot shops to Muslim traders. Leaders of BJP, Bajrang Dal and VHP had reportedly demanded that no Muslim be allowed to do business during the festival. "We agreed to their demand in interest of smooth conduct of the festival," committee chief said.

248.title: Ukraine refuses Russia's call to 'lay down arms' in Mariupol
248.article_body: After Russia gave Ukrainian forces in Mariupol until Monday morning to "lay down arms" in exchange for safe passage, Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk refused it and said, "There can be no talk of any surrender." "We've already informed...Russian side about this," she added. Earlier, the Mariupol city council had said that Russian forces bombed a school housing 400 residents.

249.title: 20-yr-old illegal arms dealer arrested in Gurugram; 25 pistols seized
249.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested for allegedly supplying illegal weapons in Gurugram on Sunday. The accused, identified as Abhishek alias Gabbar alias Kalu, was carrying multiple arms and ammunition, said police. "25 country-made pistols and two live cartridges, which he carried in a bag, have been seized… Our teams are conducting raids to nab his other associates," said police.

250.title: MakeMyTrip offers free homestays worth ₹50 lakh
250.article_body: MakeMyTrip has announced free homestays to 1,000 consumers on a first come first serve basis. Hundreds of users got their free homestays on the MakeMyTrip app yesterday as part of the offer, MakeMyTrip revealed. Users can avail the offer using coupon code 'FREEHOMESTAY' while choosing from 25,000+ properties. The offer is available from March 20 to 23.

251.title: Chandigarh admin declares 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in Union Territory
251.article_body: The Chandigarh administration has declared Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in the Union Territory. "Multiplexes and cinema theatre operators will not charge Union Territory Goods and Service Tax (UTGST) from the people. The order will be in effect for four months," an official statement read. The film has already been declared tax-free in several other states.

252.title: She looked rather lovely: Chunky on trolls criticising daughter Ananya's outfit
252.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday recently attended producer Apoorva Mehta's 50th birthday party, wearing a black thigh-high slit sheer dress. Several users trolled her for the choice of her outfit. Reacting to the trolls, her father, actor Chunky Panday said that Ananya looked "rather lovely". He  further added, "If her dad doesn't mind, then I don't think anyone else should mind."

253.title: Barcelona end 5-match losing streak vs Real Madrid with 4-0 win in El Clasico
253.article_body: Barcelona ended their five-match losing streak against Real Madrid with a 4-0 win in Sunday night's El Clasico. Ex-Arsenal striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored twice while Ronald Araujo and Ferran Torres added a goal each. The victory is Barcelona's seventh in their last eight games across competitions. They are now placed third on the La Liga points table with 54 points.

254.title: A lot has been said, what I'll do to silence them is perform: Andre Russell
254.article_body: West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell, who was retained by KKR ahead of the mega auction, has said he's proud to play for the franchise in the upcoming IPL season. "A lot has been said about me...But, what I'll do to silence them, is perform...kill the negativity with kindness," said Russell, who scored 183 runs in 10 games last season.

255.title: 4 people arrested in Lucknow for murder, violence on Holi
255.article_body: Four people were arrested in Lucknow on Sunday in connection with murder and violence on Holi, police officials said. Two people were arrested for the murder of a 35-year-old man in Madiyaon, the officials added. Two others were held for stabbing a 25-year-old man over a dispute during Holi revelry in Para, the officials stated.

256.title: Domestic help arrested for theft in Noida; ₹6.5 lakh cash recovered
256.article_body: A man named Shivam Kumar, working as a domestic help in Noida, has been arrested for allegedly robbing his employer's house in Noida sector 14. Police have also recovered ₹6.5 lakh cash and jewellery worth ₹5 lakh from the accused. Police said that Shivam had used master key to break into almirahs while the employer and his family were away.

257.title: Prez Kovind inaugurates Mughal-style heritage park in Delhi
257.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind inaugurated a Mughal-era inspired heritage park near Jama Masjid in Delhi on Sunday. Named after Charti Lal Goel, the first speaker of the Delhi Legislative Assembly, the park is spread across 8,650 sqm. "One can find different features including baradaris, an open-air theatre, panorama, chhatris, among others at the park," said an official.

258.title: People seen burying dead neighbours by roadside in Ukraine's Mariupol
258.article_body: People were seen burying their dead neighbours in a makeshift grave by the roadside in Mariupol, a city in eastern Ukraine that has seen some of the heaviest bombardment since Russia began its invasion. A man said his neighbours were not killed by shells but had died of ailments worsened by the stress in lack of medical help.

259.title: Delhi's maximum temperature rises to 38°C; highest so far this season
259.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi on Sunday was recorded at 38.3 degrees Celsius, which is eight degrees above the normal for this time of the year at the Safdarjung weather observatory. This is the highest maximum temperature that Delhi has seen so far this season. The minimum temperature recorded on Sunday was 21.2 degrees Celsius, five degrees above normal.

260.title: No objection to teaching Bhagavad Gita in schools: Siddaramaiah
260.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah said that he does not have any objections to teaching the Bhagavad Gita in schools. "Children are taught Bhagavad Gita, Ramayana and Mahabharata at home as well. Moral education should be taught to children," Siddaramaiah added. "The country believes in a pluralistic society and we believe in harmony and tolerance," he stated.

261.title: Preity Zinta shares pics from her first Holi in US since becoming mother
261.article_body: Actress and Punjab Kings owner Preity Zinta took to Instagram to share pictures from her first Holi since becoming mother. She wrote, "Even though the world isn't perfect right now & there is little to celebrate...We couldn't let...Holi go by without celebrating it as new parents. Our first big desi celebration since the pandemic & since the babies were born."

262.title: 19-yr-old driver of SUV that hit and killed infant in Hyderabad arrested
262.article_body: A 19-year-old man, Syed Afnan Ahmed, has been arrested after the SUV he was driving, hit and killed an infant in Hyderabad on March 17. Police said that the SUV had rammed into three street vendors and the two infants who were in their mothers' laps had fallen down. One of them was later declared dead at Apollo hospital.

263.title: How can I be an outsider if PM can contest from Varanasi: Sinha
263.article_body: TMC candidate for Asansol Shatrughan Sinha on Sunday questioned the BJP's allegation that he is an "outsider from Bihar", saying, "How can I be an outsider if PM Narendra Modi who comes from Gujarat [can] contest from Kashi (Varanasi)." Furthermore, he praised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and called her a "historic leader in true sense and a tigress".

264.title: Mother delayed death to help us be accustomed to emptiness: KPAC Lalitha's son
264.article_body: Late actress KPAC Lalitha's son Sidharth Bharathan said that he feels his mother delayed her own death to help them get accustomed to the emptiness she would leave behind. "She did not leave us at once...she stopped talking, stopped responding...stayed like that for a while. Towards the end, she lost her memory. She did not respond to anything," Sidharth added.

265.title: Cong doesn't know many of its MLAs will join BJP: Sarma on RS polls
265.article_body: Ahead of Rajya Sabha elections for two seats in Assam, state CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said that "Congress doesn't know that many of their MLAs are going to join the BJP." He added that "candidates are not bound to follow the whip issued in the party" in these polls. "We'll manage to get both the seats," he asserted.

266.title: India reports 1,549 new COVID-19 cases, 31 deaths; active cases at 25,106
266.article_body: India has reported 1,549 new COVID-19 cases and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 31 deaths, 11 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 20 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,510, and the active cases declined to 25,106.

267.title: Pune records 29 new COVID-19 infections, active cases drop below 500
267.article_body: The Pune district recorded 29 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday including four in Pune rural and 19 in Pune city. The number of active cases in the district dropped below 500, standing at 420. No deaths were registered during this period, keeping the total fatality count at 20,513. Over 1.75 crore vaccine doses have been administered so far.

268.title: Taylor Fritz ends Nadal's 20-match winning streak to win Indian Wells title
268.article_body: American player Taylor Fritz ended 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal's 20-match winning streak to win the BNP Paribas Open. Fritz, who had an injured ankle, defeated Nadal 6-3, 7-6 (7-5) to claim his career's second ATP Tour trophy. "This is just one of those childhood dreams you just think would never come true," said Fritz.

269.title: Akshaye Khanna deserves lot of credit for Race's success; he's gifted: Saif
269.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan, who worked with actor Akshaye Khanna in 'Race', praised his performance in the film. Speaking about Akshaye, Saif said, "Akshaye deserves a lot of credit for making 'Race' what it is by performing his role in such a special way." "He is...a gifted actor and he had a lot of fun with that role," Saif added.

270.title: Hyd body urge to speak against domestic violence, say 'help will arrive'
270.article_body: The Women and Children Safety Wing of Cyberabad in Hyderabad took to Twitter to share a post about domestic violence and urged people to speak about it. The safety wing also provided number for victims to call on. "Report crimes against women and help will arrive soon," the post read. It also said, "Don't keep your lips sealed shut."

271.title: 4 arrested as interstate drugs racket busted in Hyd, heroin seized
271.article_body: An interstate drugs racket was busted by a Special Operation Team of the Hyderabad Police. The official Twitter handle of Rachakonda Police confirmed that four people were arrested by officers following the raid. The force seized 16 grams of heroin (brown sugar), which had been transported from West Bengal to Hyderabad, cash and five mobile phones from their possession.

272.title: Son of shop owner and worker fall into basement of Delhi factory, suffocate to death
272.article_body: Two men suffocated to death after they slipped on makeshift stairs and fell into a basement filled with wooden logs at a cycle rickshaw assembling factory in Delhi. Police said the logs were sprayed with pesticide, used to prevent foliage and insect growth on wood, which led to the deaths. The stairs were made with loose planks, police added.

273.title: Body of 21-year-old Indian student killed in Ukraine arrives in Bengaluru
273.article_body: The body of the 21-year-old Indian student who was killed in Russian shelling in war-torn Ukraine arrived in Bengaluru in the early hours of Monday. Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who was studying at the Kharkiv National Medical University, died on March 1. Gyanagoudar's family members and Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai were present at Bengaluru airport to receive the body.

274.title: Biden to travel to Ukraine's neighbour Poland over Russian invasion
274.article_body: US President Joe Biden will travel to Poland on Friday to meet President Andrzej Duda for discussions over Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the White House has said. "The President will discuss how the US, alongside our Allies and partners, is responding to the humanitarian and human rights crisis that Russia's unjustified and unprovoked war on Ukraine has created," it said.

275.title: When is a Test match pitch rated 'below average'?
275.article_body:
As per ICC, a pitch is rated 'below average' when it has either very little carry and/or bounce and/or more than occasional seam movement, or occasional variable (but not excessive or dangerous) bounce and/or occasional variable carry. "A pitch...with...these features...cannot be rated in higher category regardless
of the amount of turn it displays at any stage," the rule further states.

276.title: Railways to resume seasonal pass service on Pune-Mumbai route
276.article_body: The Central Railway will resume the seasonal pass and unreserved passenger services on the Pune-Mumbai route from March 22, said authorities. The services will be made available for Deccan Queen Express, Intercity Express, Indrayani Express, Deccan Express and Sinhagad Express trains. Notably, the services had been stopped since March 2020 owing to COVID-19 pandemic.

277.title: B'luru customs seize antique bronze statue from shipment; 1 held
277.article_body: Bengaluru Airport and Air Cargo Commissionerate's Customs Intelligence Unit officials on Sunday intercepted a shipment containing an antique bronze statue of Lord Vishnu, believed to be over a hundred years old. The exporter, who was attempting to send it to Malaysia, has been arrested. The statue was certified by a nominee authorised by the Director General, Archaeological Survey of India.

278.title: 3 threaten man out on walk, force him to transfer ₹76,000 in Pune
278.article_body: An FIR has been filed after three persons allegedly threatened to kill a man and his female friend and forced the man to digitally transfer ₹76,000 in Pune. The duo had been out on a walk on Pashan Hill and was sitting on a rock when the accused approached them, according to the FIR. The incident took place on Friday.

279.title: Every Indian must watch 'The Kashmir Files': Aamir Khan
279.article_body: Aamir Khan has said every Indian must watch 'The Kashmir Files'. "What happened to Kashmiri Pandits is a matter of great sorrow. Such a film must be watched by all Indians so...they can remember what occurred," he said. "This film has touched...emotions of all people who believe in humanity and that is what is so beautiful about it," stated Aamir.

280.title: Dad never let me use family name privilege: Mithun's son
280.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty's son Mimoh Chakraborty said that his father never let him use the "privilege of family name" and that he is facing his own demons. "He [Mithun] told me that if I wanted something I have to earn it," Mimoh said, adding that Mithun's work is "unlimited" and that "there is no stopping him".

281.title: 30 arrested after police raid bar in Mumbai's Malad; 25 women rescued
281.article_body: Thirty persons were arrested and 25 women were rescued after Mumbai Police's Crime Branch raided a bar in the city's Malad area. "A decoy customer found women dancing in violation of norms, following which the raid was carried out," a police officer said. The 30 arrested persons include customers, waiters and other staff of the eatery-cum-bar, according to the officer.

282.title: 1,000 Olive Ridley turtle hatchlings released on Visakhapatnam beach
282.article_body: As many as 1,000 hatchlings of Olive Ridley turtles were released into the sea at Visakhapatnam's RK Beach on Sunday. District collector Mallikarjuna and forest officials reportedly released the endangered turtles into the water. District Forest Officer Anant Shankar said multiple hatcheries have been set up by their team to protect the rare turtles from being eaten by other animals.

283.title: Elon Musk among witnesses in Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's court case
283.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has been included in list of witnesses slated to testify in a defamation lawsuit filed by Johnny Depp against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Depp has alleged that Heard had an extra-marital affair with Musk and James Franco while they were married. Both Musk and Franco are scheduled to testify virtually during the trial next month.

284.title: Paris taxi driver files complaint against Tesla for crash that killed 1
284.article_body: A Paris taxi driver has filed a legal complaint against Tesla after his Tesla Model 3 crashed in December, killing one person. The driver told police that the car accelerated on its own and that he was unable to activate the brakes. Earlier, the French government while quoting Tesla said there was no immediate indication of a technical fault.

285.title: 2 Mumbai metro corridors likely to become operational by mid-April
285.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) said the Dahisar East-DN Nagar and Dahisar East-Andheri East metro corridors will likely get safety clearance by March-end. Around two to three days of safety inspection is pending, officials said. They added that after receiving the safety clearance certificates, the two corridors are likely to become operational by mid-April.

286.title: Kashmiri pandits' pain too tragic to be manipulated: Cong MP Gogoi
286.article_body: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi on Sunday took to Twitter to ask whether an Indian mode of healing and reconciliation in Kashmir could be developed. He added, "The pain and anguish of Kashmiri Pandits are too real and tragic to be...ignored or...manipulated. People of J&K deserve peace, justice and fraternity." His comments came amid the ongoing controversy around 'The Kashmir Files'.

287.title: Multipurpose women's co-op societies to start in all K'taka taluks
287.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday announced that the multipurpose women's cooperative societies will be started in every taluk of the state. The societies are understood to have 90% share capital from the state government. CM Bommai said the "government has decided to establish a milk producers bank to ensure that the profit goes to milk producers".

288.title: Man tries to enter Hindon air base illegally, arrested by IAF
288.article_body: A man has been apprehended by Indian Air Force officials after he allegedly attempted to get inside the force's Hindon airbase near Delhi in an unauthorised manner. The incident is said to have taken place in the city on Sunday. An IAF official informed that the accused has been handed over to local police for further action following initial interrogation.

289.title: AAP's Gopal Rai inaugurates new party office in Chhattisgarh
289.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Gopal Rai inaugurated a new party office in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Sunday. "We've been receiving...calls from...people of the state to join the party," said Rai who'll be participating in 'Vijay Yatra' in the capital on Monday to mark AAP's victory in Punjab. The party is reportedly planning to contest the Chhattisgarh assembly elections next year.

290.title: Coimbatore school teacher runs first cactus museum in Tamil Nadu
290.article_body: A school teacher in Coimbatore is reportedly running the first cactus museum in Tamil Nadu. The teacher, identified as Sheemalatha, said the museum has over a thousand varieties of the plant. She added, "I've been growing cactus since 2006 to create awareness among people who think cactus resembles negativity."  Pictures from the place show students examining the plant's different varieties.

291.title: Remove genitalia models from family planning kits, Maha govt urged
291.article_body: Political parties and activists in Maharashtra's Buldhana district have urged state government to remove "embarrassing" rubber models of male and female reproductive organs from family planning counselling kits. "How will Asha workers explain about it?" Prashant Dikkar of Swabhimani Shetkari Sanghatana said. Meanwhile, a social worker claimed Asha workers had approached her saying they feel shy.

292.title: They're never flustered: Cummins on Kohli, Babar, Root, Williamson
292.article_body: Commenting on similarities between top batters in the world including Virat Kohli, Kane Williamson, Joe Root and Babar Azam, Australia Test captain Pat Cummins said they're "never flustered" and are happy to bat for long periods of time. "All know their game incredibly well...if there's an opportunity, they get off the mark pretty quickly, start accumulating...runs really quickly," he stated.

293.title: Federer is guitar solo, Nadal, Serena are like heavy metal: Musician Wentz
293.article_body: Asked to describe musical comparisons of playing styles of Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Serena Williams, musician Pete Wentz said Federer is a "guitar solo" and for Nadal and Serena their game resembles "heavy metal". He added, "When you see Federer play, you're seeing something that's so incredibly beautiful." Wentz is bassist and lyricist for rock band Fall Out Boy.

294.title: State govt hoarded 'tuvar dal', over 70 lakh people affected: Cong
294.article_body: The Gujarat government, along with black marketers, has hoarded 'tuvar dal' supply for the past four months, the Congress said on Sunday. Gujarat Pradesh Congress Committee (GPCC) spokesperson Manish Doshi accused the state government of not providing 'tuvar dal' to over 70.81 lakh beneficiaries, adding that several claims about distributing food grains at cheaper rates were made in the past.

295.title: Nashik Police to summon Rajasthan CM's son in cheating case
295.article_body: Nashik Police has said that it'll summon 14 accused in a cheating case, including Rajasthan’s Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot's son Vaibhav Gehlot, for questioning this week. This comes after a complaint was filed by a Nashik-based businessman on March 17 who claimed that he was lured into investing in a company with which Vaibhav was allegedly affiliated.

296.title: UP govt creates 5,000 new police posts across units like ATS & STF
296.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government has announced the creation of 5,000 new posts across several units of the police, including the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) and Special Task Force (STF). The UP Police is also set to get a specialised team to keep an eye on drone activities to boost security in the state, according to reports.

297.title: Lakshya Sen wins silver at All England Open, loses to world no. 1 Axelsen in final
297.article_body: India's 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen won the silver medal at All England Open Badminton Championships 2022, bagging India's first medal in men's singles in the tournament in 21 years. World number one men's player Viktor Axelsen of Denmark defeated Lakshya with a scoreline of 21-10, 21-15 to win his second All England Open title.

298.title: Drunk driver, conductor abandon bus with passengers in Guj; booked
298.article_body: A driver and a conductor, who abandoned a passenger-filled state transport bus in Gujarat's Ahmedabad after causing an accident while in an inebriated state on Sunday, have been booked under the Prohibition Act. The pair are, however, yet to be identified. Police said that they recovered six bottles of illicit Indian Made Foreign Liquor 'whisky' from the driver’s cabin.

299.title: 10,000 people attend 'anti-war' concert in Berlin amid Ukraine crisis
299.article_body: Around 10,000 people attended an 'anti-war' concert in Berlin on Sunday to express solidarity with Ukraine, police said. The concert took place near Brandenburg Gate, which was symbol of divided Germany during Cold War, with people waving Ukrainian flags and holding anti-invasion banners. The performers included Natalia Klitschko, a Ukrainian singer who's married to Kyiv's Mayor Vitali Klitschko.

300.title: Reigning world champion Yamaguchi wins maiden All England title
300.article_body: Reigning world champion Akane Yamaguchi won her maiden All England Championships women's singles title in Birmingham on Sunday. The 24-year-old second seed defeated fourth seed An Seyoung 21-15, 21-15 of Korea in 44 minutes. Yamaguchi had reached the final in 2018 but lost to Tai Tzu Ying. It's the Japanese shuttler's 18th career and a ninth world tour title.

301.title: PayPal expands services for Ukrainian users, waives transaction fees
301.article_body: PayPal said it is expanding services in Ukraine and Ukrainians will now be able to send and receive money from friends and family. Earlier, PayPal users in Ukraine could only send money internationally from their accounts and not receive it. PayPal is also waiving transaction fees for remittances to Ukrainian accounts.

302.title: Zelenskyy questions lack of 'powerful' Israeli sanctions on Russia
302.article_body: During his address to the Israeli Parliament, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Why Israel hasn't imposed powerful sanctions on Russia or isn't putting pressure on Russian business." He also questioned Israel's reluctance to sell the Iron Dome system to Ukraine. "Everybody knows that your missile defence systems are the best...and that you can definitely help...save...lives," he said.

303.title: PM Modi clearly used his contacts to call for end of war: Australia
303.article_body: Australian High Commissioner to India Barry O'Farrell said the Quad nations of Australia, Japan and the US have accepted India's stand on the Russia-Ukraine conflict. "It's clear from the comments of...Prime Minister Narendra Modi...that he has used his contacts to call for the end of the conflict and no country will be unhappy with that," said O'Farrell.

304.title: Hyderabad FC clinch their maiden ISL title after defeating Kerala Blasters on penalties
304.article_body: Hyderabad FC defeated Kerala Blasters 3-1 on penalties in final to win their maiden Indian Super League (ISL) title. Rahul KP scored for Kerala Blasters in 68th minute before Hyderabad FC's Sahil Tavora equalised in 88th minute as the match went to extra time and then penalties. Kerala Blasters have now lost all of their three finals in ISL.

305.title: Govt plans to merge BBNL and BSNL this month: BSNL chief
305.article_body: Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) Chairman and MD PK Purwar said the government has decided to merge BSNL and Bharat Broadband Nigam Limited (BBNL) this month. He added that the government has given BSNL an opportunity to turnaround their losses. With the proposed merger, BSNL will get 5.67 lakh kilometre of optical fibre network laid across 1.85 lakh village panchayats.

306.title: 'Donate 'The Kashmir Files' profits for Brahmin kids,' says MP IAS officer
306.article_body: MP Public Works Department's Deputy Secretary Niyaz Khan has triggered a controversy by saying that all the earnings of 'The Kashmir Files' must be donated for Brahmin children's education and construction of homes for them in Kashmir. "It will be a great charity," said Khan in a now-viral tweet. MP minister Vishwas Sarang said he'll seek action against Khan.

307.title: K'taka CM thanks PM for efforts to bring Naveen's body from Ukraine
307.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi to thank him for his efforts in bringing back the mortal remains of Naveen Shekharappa, who was killed in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv. The fourth-year medical student from Karnataka was killed in a shelling attack. His mortal remains will reach Bengaluru on March 21.

308.title: Attempts being made to divide the country once again: Mehbooba
308.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday said that attempts are being made to divide the country once again on communal lines. "If we allow this religious division to happen, the sacrifice of freedom fighters like Bhagat Singh will go in vain. Therefore, do not allow Gandhi to die once again," she further said.

309.title: 42-year-old man abducts, rapes 8-year-old girl in Nagpur; arrested
309.article_body: A 42-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a mentally unwell eight-year-old girl in Nagpur's  Imamwada area on Sunday, police said. The accused, who runs a juice stall in the locality, allegedly abducted the girl and raped her at his house, police added. The victim later narrated the ordeal to her sister, following which a police complaint was registered.

310.title: US Indo-Pacific strategy as dangerous as NATO expansion in Europe: China
310.article_body: China's Vice Foreign Minister Le Yucheng on Saturday said that the US' Indo-Pacific strategy and creation of groups such as Quad are as "dangerous" as NATO's eastward expansion in Europe. "The Ukraine crisis...provides a mirror for us to observe the situation in the Asia-Pacific," he added. Notably, Chinese officials have blamed NATO's potential expansion for triggering the crisis in Ukraine.

311.title: Vinod Kapri shares clip of 19-yr-old man running in Noida at midnight, video viral
311.article_body: Filmmaker Vinod Kapri has shared a video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight. In the clip, Kapri offered Pradeep Mehra a lift, which he refused and said he runs 10 km daily, from his job in Sector 16 to his home in Barola. Refusing dinner with Kapri, Mehra said his brother back home will be left hungry.

312.title: Leclerc wins F1 2022 season-opening race, Max Verstappen fails to finish
312.article_body: Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc won the Bahrain Grand Prix, the first race of Formula One 2022 season, with his teammate Carlos Sainz finishing second. Meanwhile, Formule One 2021 champion Max Verstappen failed to finish the race due to a mechanical issue with his car. Seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton finished third after Sergio Perez spun in the last lap.

313.title: At least 10 dead after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar on Holi
313.article_body: At least 10 people died after consuming spurious liquor in two districts of dry Bihar during Holi celebrations, police said on Sunday. Eight deaths were reported in the Bhagalpur district, including four in the Sahebganj locality of Bhagalpur town and the remaining in different villages in the Narayanpur police station area.

314.title: Importance of Alia's character in 'RRR' is high: Director Rajamouli
314.article_body: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli said Alia Bhatt's role in the film isn't a full-fledged character but is an important cameo. He added they needed a "fragile-looking girl" with "enough inner strength" to lead Ram Charan and Jr NTR's characters in a proper way. Talking about the length of character, Rajamouli stated, "It's less but the importance of the character is...high."

315.title: Haryana Guv, CM inaugurate 35th Surajkund International Crafts Mela
315.article_body: Haryana Governor Bandaru Dattatreya and Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday inaugurated the 35th Surajkund International Crafts Mela. Governor Dattatreya praised the Ministries of central government and Haryana government during the session for organising it. CM Khattar said the fair helps thousands of craftspersons from India to showcase their arts and products to a wider audience.

316.title: China fully militarised 3 islands in South China Sea: US Admiral
316.article_body: US' Indo-Pacific commander Admiral John Aquilino on Sunday said that China has fully militarised at least three of several islands it built in the disputed South China Sea. China has deployed anti-ship and anti-aircraft missile systems, laser and jamming equipment and fighter jets on them, he added. The efforts are part of China flexing its military muscle, he further said.

317.title: At least 115 children killed, over 150 hurt in Ukraine so far: Report
317.article_body: At least 115 children were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24, reported local media citing Ukrainian Chief Prosecutor's office. The prosecutor's office added that more than 150 children were injured in Ukraine since the invasion began. “These numbers are not just figures but the scale of grief... of hundreds of Ukrainian families,” the prosecutor's office said.

318.title: BJP promoting 'The Kashmir Files' to win Guj, Raj elections: Raut
318.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday accused the BJP of promoting 'The Kashmir Files' with an eye on the forthcoming Assembly polls in Gujarat and Rajasthan. He added that an attempt has been made in the film to suppress several "harsh truths". The film has been brought to the screen with inspiration from the Sangh Parivar (RSS), he claimed.

319.title: Ranvir in 'Race' was an opportunity to play more serious role: Saif
319.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan, talking about his role in the 2008 film 'Race', said that playing Ranvir in the film was an opportunity for him to play "a slightly more serious role". He added, "At that point, I had done a lot of chocolate boy roles and Race was different." The film completes 14 years of its release on Monday.

320.title: My tenure as Goa CM is over, will gladly accept duty given: Sawant
320.article_body: Ahead of BJP's legislature party meeting in Goa, state's caretaker CM Pramod Sawant has said he'll "gladly accept" whatever responsibility BJP gives him. "My...tenure has come to an end...I'm happy that I was able to get 20 seats for [BJP]," he said. The decision about the swearing-in ceremony of the next CM will be taken on Monday, Sawant had said.

321.title: He just stands and hits them out of park: KL Rahul on Shreyas Iyer
321.article_body: Praising Shreyas Iyer for his ability to tackle spin and putting spinners under pressure, LSG skipper KL Rahul said he "dreads" KKR captain when his side plays against them in upcoming IPL. "He's one of the players who doesn't really step out too much...is a tall boy, so has a long reach. He just stands...hits them out of...park," he stated.

322.title: Our Hindutva not like BJP, Shiv Sena won't ally with AIMIM: Maha CM
322.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said that Shiv Sena will not form an alliance with Asaduddin Owaisi and All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen, adding that his party's Hindutva is not like BJP. He also asked Shiv Sena's members to be ready to defeat BJP. Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Saturday called AIMIM the "B team" of the BJP.

323.title: PM Modi has given respect to North-Eastern states: Tripura CM
323.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb on Sunday said PM Narendra Modi "has given respect to the North-Eastern states". "All the Chief Ministers of the North-East region have been tied into the same string of development," Deb said. He added that only after PM Modi came to power did Chief Ministers of small states get "equal importance and patient hearing".

324.title: US toy company raises money for Ukraine with Zelenskyy's 'Lego' figures
324.article_body: A Chicago artist has designed a Lego-style figurine of the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a bid to raise money for Ukraine. Joe Trupia, the owner of Citizen Brick, a toy manufacturing company, has no personal connections to the war but felt compelled to help. Citizen Brick has raised over $145,000 and donated it to a charity organisation helping Ukraine.

325.title: Russian attack kills 56 people at nursing home in Luhansk: Report
325.article_body: Russian tank attack killed 56 people at a nursing home in Ukraine's Luhansk Oblast on March 11, reported local media citing Luhansk Governor Serhiy Hayday. Hayday added Russians moved 15 survivors to a facility in the occupied territories. Meanwhile, at least 902 civilians were killed and 1,459 injured since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

326.title: When is a movie declared tax-free?
326.article_body: There are no fixed criteria for a film to claim or enjoy tax exemption and the decision to give up tax revenues by state governments are taken on a film-to-film basis. When a film deals with a socially relevant or inspiring subject, state governments waive tax on it to make it accessible to a wider audience.

327.title: Thieves break into BJP MP's Chhattisgarh home on Holi, steal ₹1 lakh
327.article_body: Thieves broke into the residence of BJP Rajya Sabha MP Ramvichar Netam in Chhattisgarh's Ambikapur on Holi on Friday and stole ₹1 lakh, police said on Sunday. A senior police officer said that guards of his residence are being questioned. He added that the police are investigating the matter.

328.title: Germany secures Qatar energy deal amid Russia gas supply tensions
328.article_body: Germany and Qatar have agreed upon a long-term energy partnership to help cut reliance on Russian gas amid its invasion of Ukraine, German Economic Minister Robert Habeck said on Sunday. "Although we might still need Russian gas this year, in...future [we won't]," Habeck added. Notably, Germany also suspended its Nord Stream 2 pipeline project with Russia last month.

329.title: Ferry struck by cargo ship sinks in river in Bangladesh, 6 dead
329.article_body: At least six people were killed after a ferry packed with passengers collided with a cargo vessel on a river and sank in central Bangladesh on Sunday. Dozens of passengers are still missing and a rescue operation for them is being carried out, officials said. Nearly two dozen people had managed to swim ashore, an official said.

330.title: Section 144 imposed in Nizamabad after clash over new Shivaji statue
330.article_body: Telangana government imposed Section 144 in the Nizamabad district on Sunday after members of two political groups clashed over the installation of a statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. The order is said to have been imposed in the Bodhan town to prohibit further escalation of the matter. Activists of both parties reportedly pelted stones at each other during the clash.

331.title: Schools, colleges shut in Andaman & Nicobar ahead of Cyclone Asani
331.article_body: All schools and colleges have been closed amid heavy rains and strong winds in the Andaman and Nicobar islands ahead of Cyclone Asani. The Union Territory's administration has taken the step as a preventive measure beginning March 21. All planned boat sailings in the foreshore zone have also been cancelled and passengers are being encouraged to consult helpline numbers.

332.title: Appalling and awful: UK FM on ferry firm firing 800 staff over Zoom
332.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said the way that P&O Ferries has treated its workers is appalling and awful. The UK-based ferry company last week fired 800 employees without any warning over a Zoom video. According to a report by Sunday Times, several government ministers were aware of the company's plans to fire employees before P&O Ferries' staff was informed.

333.title: 3 live hand grenades found outside pvt university in Haryana
333.article_body: Three live hand grenades were recovered from an empty ground outside a private university on the Ambala-Chandigarh highway in Haryana on Sunday, police said. They have been defused, the Superintendent of Police (SP) said. He added that the NIA and other central agencies have also been informed.

334.title: All parties, including mine, divide people: Congress' Ghulam Nabi
334.article_body: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad, speaking at an event in Jammu on Sunday, said that all political parties, including his own, create divisions among the people along caste and religious lines. He added, "Civil society should stay together. Justice must be given to everyone irrespective of caste and religion." His remarks came amid the ongoing controversy over 'The Kashmir Files'.

335.title: PM chairs meeting over govt formation in UP, U'khand, Goa: Reports
335.article_body: PM Narendra Modi chaired a meeting at his residence on Sunday over the government formation in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Goa, as per reports. Union Ministers Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh, BJP National General Secretary (organisation) BL Santhosh, party President JP Nadda were reportedly present. Yogi Adityanath will take oath as UP CM for the second term on March 25.

336.title: Indian cueist Pankaj Advani wins 8th Asian Billiards C'ship title
336.article_body: Indian cueist Pankaj Advani defeated compatriot Dhruv Sitwala 6-2 to win his eighth title at 19th Asian Billiards Championship 2022 on Saturday in Doha, Qatar. Overall, it was the 24-time world champion's 12th Asian title. "This isn't a quadrennial event, it tests you every single year, every single match!" said Pankaj. Notably, it was 36-year-old Pankaj's 41st international title.

337.title: Working to improve tax literacy & number of taxpayers: CBDT chief
337.article_body: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said the Income Tax department is working to improve the "abysmally poor" tax literacy in the country to increase the number of taxpaying entities and enhance collections. "Banks have invested in expanding the banking knowledge of the people. That thing has not happened in (income) tax and that is on top of our mind," he said.

338.title: Tiger is biggest action hero the industry currently has: Ahmed Khan
338.article_body: Director Ahmed Khan has said that Tiger Shroff is the biggest and the youngest action hero the film industry currently has. "The way he manoeuvres complex action sequences and makes them look super effortless, speaks volumes of his constant dedication because this guy...puts his 200% into his work," he added. Tiger's upcoming film 'Heropanti 2' is directed by Ahmed.

339.title: No, not really: Kanye's girlfriend Chaney on if she resembles Kim
339.article_body: On being asked if she sees the resemblance between herself and Kim Kardashian, rapper Kanye West's girlfriend Chaney Jones replied, "No, not really." Chaney added that she and Kanye don't talk about Kim. Instagram model Chaney gained popularity for being a lookalike of Kim. Earlier, Chaney took to Instagram and posted pictures with Kanye and captioned it, "Date night."

340.title: Haven't had kaju katli in 27 years, sugar is biggest poison: John
340.article_body: During a True or False session with Shilpa Shetty, actor John Abraham revealed that he hasn't had his favourite sweet, kaju katli, for 27 years. "I believe...that sugar is the biggest poison in the world, more than cigarette smoking," he stated. John further added that he does not have aerated drinks. John will next be seen in 'Ek Villain Returns'.

341.title: I'm not very good at handling stress and pressure: Ananya Panday
341.article_body: Ananya Panday has said that she's not good at handling work stress and pressure. "I'm quite young...sometimes it gets to me...but I try to detach myself, spend time with my friends and my family, and ground myself in the real world," she added. Ananya further said, "I like to do things that make me happy or make time for myself."

342.title: Punjab govt forms new SIT in SAD leader Majithia's drug case
342.article_body: The newly-formed Punjab government has formed a new Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader Bikram Singh Majithia in a drug case. The four-member SIT will be headed by Assistant Inspector General of Police Rahul S. Majithia is currently lodged in the Patiala jail as his judicial custody was earlier extended till March 22.

343.title: Cong holds 'Tiranga Yatra' in MP, observes 'Samvidhan Samman Diwas'
343.article_body: The Congress Committee in Madhya Pradesh's Indore took out a 'Tiranga Yatra' on Sunday to mark two years since the day Kamal Nath resigned as CM after his government was toppled. Party workers shouted anti-BJP slogans while observing the day as 'Samvidhan Samman Diwas'. "BJP had insulted...Constitution by forming...government by horse-trading," City Congress president Vinay Bakliwal said.

344.title: If talks with Putin fail, it could mean third world war: Zelenskyy
344.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that he is ready for negotiations with Russian President Vladimir Putin, adding, "But if they fail, it could mean World War 3." He added, "If there's just 1% chance for us to stop this war, I think that we need to take this chance." He said that negotiations are crucial to ending the war.

345.title: Reliance Retail acquires 89% stake in women's innerwear brand Clovia
345.article_body: Reliance Retail Ventures Limited (RRVL) has acquired an 89% equity stake in Purple Panda Fashions Private Limited, which owns and operates Clovia, a brand for women's innerwear and loungewear. Reliance made an investment of ₹950 crore through a combination of secondary stake purchase and primary investment. Clovia was launched in 2013 by Pankaj Vermani, Neha Kant and Suman Chowdhury.

346.title: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett to make his 1st visit to India on April 2
346.article_body: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett will arrive in India on his first official visit on April 2, according to a statement from his office. Bennett's visit comes on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries. "This visit will reaffirm the important connection between the countries," the statement read.

347.title: Taiwan reports 121 new COVID-19 cases, zero deaths in last 24 hours
347.article_body: Taiwan on Sunday logged 121 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths in last 24 hours. As per Taiwan's Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC), out of 121 new cases, 118 were imported cases and three were locally transmitted infections. Out of the new local infections, two were connected to a cluster in Chiayi and third was reported in Tainan, added CECC.

348.title: Was rejected several times due to women investors' absence: Nykaa Fashion CEO
348.article_body: Nykaa Fashion CEO Adwaita Nayar said she and Co-founder Falguni Nayar were rejected by several investors as they didn't have women in decision-making positions. "All of them said no-no, we're not interested. The same investors who are now super interested," Nayar said. She added that if women don't hold key positions, it becomes difficult for investors to understand women-centric businesses.
